data.name: Madrid Segway Fun Tour: Old Town highlights (1h30m)
data.description: Explore Madrid on a fun and leisurely 1.5-hour guided Segway tour. Discover the secrets of the Almudena Cathedral and learn more about the history, customs, and traditions of the Spanish capital. DURATION 1.5 hours ABOUT As is always the case on each tour, we will start with the training session. Our expert guide will ensure that you feel safe and comfortable before embarking on the tour. You will also be able to verify the Segway's ease of handling. The 1.5-hour tour will first head towards the Plaza de Oriente with its beautiful views of the French gardens. In the background will be the Royal Palace, which is always so impressive in the eyes of visitors and which once housed the Spanish monarchy. The tour will continue to the Almudena Cathedral. Take the road to Madrid Rio, a new park that combines classic contemporary-style works of art. Roll along the banks of the Manzanares river and viswit the Matadero de Madrid gallery, and old butcher factory, converted into a gallery for arts and cultural events. Visit the Parque del Moro Gardens, which together with the Sabatini Gardens, surround the Royal Palace. Admire the ancient site of the Valnad gate, demolished by order of King Philip II. Observe the neoclassical faade of the Teatro Real, a style giving a cultural touch to many parts of Madrid. Finally, the visit concludes in the Plaza de Oriente, where you can have some good photographs and the best recommendations from our local specialist guide. Starting point. WE MADRID at C. de la Escalinata, 10, 28013 Madrid INCLUDES Professional Bilingual Guide to ensure a quality service and the greatest knowledge of the destination. Safety training and supervised test (additional time). Helmets and protection (all sizes). NOT INCLUDED Tips (optional). Food or beverages unless specified. Hotel pick up or transfer. WHAT TO BRING Comfortable clothing and shoes

data.description: Con este tour guiado de 5 horas descubrir dos de los lugares imprescindibles de la ciudad: el Palacio Real y el Museo del Prado. En el trayecto de un espacio a otro, conoceremos algunas de las calles y plazas ms destacadas. PUNTO DE ENCUENTRO: Plaza de Isabel II "pera"". El gua lleva paraguas blanco Horario de la visita Mircoles, viernes y domingo a las 13:00 en INGLS Acerca de Visite con su gua el Palacio Real y recorra sus salones con diferentes estilos: el Comedor de Gala, La Sala de la Corona y el Saln del Trono entre otros. Pasee por los lujosos pasillos y estancias descubriendo en primera persona como vivan los Reyes, sus costumbres, y el mejor grupo de instrumentos de cuarteto de cuerda del mundo. En el Museo del Prado contemplaremos las ms icnicas obras de arte que se exhiben en esta pinacoteca y que fueron pintadas por los ms grandes: Velzquez, El Greco, Goya, Rubens y El Bosco. Nuestro gua le acompaar en todo momento por lo que, en el trayecto de un espacio a otro, aprovechar para mostrarle algunos de los lugares ms emblemticos de la capital.

data.name: Madrid city center and Prado Museum
data.description: Join us on the first part of the tour, a one-hour walking tour through the streets of the historic city center of Madrid. Discover emblematic places you cannot miss! Stroll around Plaza de la Villa, the famous Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol and Plaza de Oriente. Then board one of our private cars for a ride through the city. Remember to bring your camera or Smartphone! Leave Plaza de Oriente and head to the magnificent Puerta de Toledo. Did you know its construction dates back from the Napoleonic era? See the oldest bridge in Madrid and drive next to the Manzanares River, from where you will have great views of the Royal Palace and the Almudena Cathedral. Pass by Mayor Street, Puerta del Sol square and the Las Cortes quarter on your way to the Paseo del Prado. Admire the architecture of the Old Madrid arriving into the Las Letras Quarter. Drive by Cibeles Fountain, where Real Madrid fans celebrate the team victories. Do not miss Puerta de Alcal, the most famous of the five ancient gates into the city. The last sights you will see on the tour are the Santiago Bernabu stadium through Paseo de la Castellana street and Colon square. However, no trip to Madrid would be completed without a visit to the Prado Museum. Follow your local guide through the Museum on a visit of the most important paintings. Admire great European artworks by el Bosco, el Greco, Velazquez, Goya and Rubens. Discover the aim of the original building and why it changed to hold one of the most important art galleries in the world. The current exhibition holds more than 1.000 paintings of four different centuries. Let your guide show you around the site and learn about some of the most important works and its backstories.

data.name: Private tour: Madrid highlights and a guided tour Royal Palace
data.description: Join us on the first part of the tour, a one-hour walking tour through the streets of the historic city center of Madrid. Discover emblematic places you cannot miss! Stroll around Plaza de la Villa, the famous Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol and Plaza de Oriente. Then board a private vehicle for a ride through the city. Remember to bring your camera or Smartphone! Leave Plaza de Oriente and head to the magnificent Puerta de Toledo. Did you know its construction dates back from the Napoleonic era? See the oldest bridge in Madrid and drive next to the Manzanares River, from where you will have great views of the Royal Palace and the Almudena Cathedral. Pass by Mayor Street, Puerta del Sol square and the Las Cortes quarter on your way to the Paseo del Prado. Admire the architecture of the Old Madrid arriving into the Las Letras Quarter. Drive by Cibeles Fountain, where Real Madrid fans celebrate the team victories. Do not miss Puerta de Alcal, the most famous of the five ancient gates into the city. The last sights you will see on the tour are the Santiago Bernabu stadium through Paseo de la Castellana street and Colon square. However, no trip to Madrid would be completed without a visit to the Royal Palace. Thus, your local guide will take you to there for a guided visit to the same. Skip the lines and dive right into the history of this beautiful palace. Did you know its size doubles the one of Buckingham Palace? Build in an Italian baroque style, it was the former residence of the Spanish Monarchy from 1766 to 1931. Nowadays, it still is a great example of the establishment of Madrid as the capital of the kingdom. Today, it holds the most important receptions of the Spanish Crown. Know the audiences, gala dinners and signature of agreements celebrated through the years. Walk around the Armory Square. Marvel at the beautiful tapestries and elegant furniture. Follow your guide through the Grand Staircase, the Throne Room and the Banqueting Hall, among others.

data.name: Private Tour to Royal Palace
data.description: Skip the lines and get inside one of the most memorable Royal Castles of Europe, the Royal Palace of Madrid, with this tour! Duration 2 Hours About The Royal Palace of Madrid used to be the official residence of the Spanish Royal Family. Nowadays, the palace is also used exclusively for receptions, ceremonies and official events. The Royal Palace is also called Palacio de Oriente, due to its proximity to the Plaza de Oriente square, which is on the east (Oriental) side of the palace. Our visit includes some of the most impressive rooms like the throne lounge, the gala dining room, the royal chapel or the parade ground. Do not miss the impressive Palace and get to know all the secret from the hand of our expert guide. Inclusions: Private Guide Entrance to the Royal Palace Exclusions: Hotel Pick up Transportation

data.name: Toledo on your Own from Madrid, Morning Half Day Tour
data.description: Register at our office in the city center of Madrid at least fifteen minutes before departure. Get on board one of our air-conditioned buses and head to Toledo. Remember to bring your camera or Smartphone! Sit back and enjoy the scenery on your way to the city. Upon arrival, marvel at this beautiful historic city declared a World Heritage City in 1986. Once the capital of Spain, the spectacular mix of Arab, Jewish and Christian cultures will leave you speechless. Get to know first-hand its fantastic heritage and discover how the coexistence of these three cultures over the centuries influenced the city current architectural style. Explore the city at your own pace and visit the church of Santo Tom, where you will be able to see one of the most famous Greco paintings. Meeting point for the return to Madrid is in front of the Hacienda del Cardenal Restaurant, very close to the Bisagra Gate.

data.name: PRIVADO: Visita guiada de la Galera de Colecciones Reales
data.description: Descubra en este tour privado de 2 horas la nueva Galera de Colecciones Reales, el proyecto musestico ms importante en Espaa en dcadas. Disfrute de un recorrido por la cultura en un edificio excepcional, a travs de una seleccin de ms de 650 obras de enorme relevancia, entre las que destacan pinturas, esculturas, armaduras, tapices, artes decorativas o carrozas firmadas por maestros de la talla de El Greco, Caravaggio, Velzquez, Tiepolo o Goya. Punto de encuentro: Plaza de Isabel II, tambin conocida como Plaza de pera Horario A determinar por el cliente. Duracin: 2 horas Acerca de En esta visita su gua le mostrar la Galera de las Colecciones Reales es un centro musestico dependiente del Patrimonio Nacional. Se encuentra en un edificio situado en los jardines del Campo del Moro, junto a la Catedral de la Almudena y al Palacio Real de dicha ciudad. Aunque en origen pensado para exponer tapices y carruajes, finalmente est destinado a albergar, tambin, objetos suntuarios, mobiliario, escultura, elementos arquitectnicos, pinturas y otras piezas de arte o histricas que los distintos reyes de Espaa fueron atesorando a lo largo de su historia. Entre las 650 piezas, entre pinturas, mobiliario y maquetas que se expondrn en el Museo de forma permanente o temporal destacan: - El Polptico de Isabel la Catlica de Juan de Flandes. - El Caballo Blanco de Diego Velzquez. - Salom con la cabeza de Juan el Bautista de Caravaggio. - Lamentacin sobre Cristo muerto de Anton Raphael Mengs. - La armadura y celada empleadas por Carlos V en la batalla de Mhlberg. - La carroza negra de la reina Mariana de Austria.

data.name: Guided tour of the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum ENGLISH. SMALL GROUP
data.description: Enjoy a semi-private visit with small groups of up to 7 people, with the convenience of listening to the guide in a single language. Admire one of the best works in the museum: Saint Catherine of Alexandria by Caravaggio. Discover Degas's The Swaying Dancer. Portrait of Giovanna Tornabuoni by Domenico Ghirlandaio. MEETING POINT: Main Entrance to the Thyssen Museum. Paseo del Prado, 8. The guide carries a white umbrella. Visiting hours Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays at 12:30 p.m. in ENGLISH. Duration 90 minutes About Close to a thousand works ranging from the 13th to the 20th centuries have made this museum one of the most outstanding internationally. The Collection includes artists of the stature of Titian, Rubens, Rembrandt, Caravaggio, Manet, Renoir, Van Gogh, Gauguin, Kandinsky, Hopper or Picasso. This gallery provides numerous examples of foreign painters who had not been present until then: Italian and Flemish primitives, key works of the Renaissance, numerous works from the Impressionist era, such as Monet, Degas, Van Gogh and Gauguin. It also has outstanding works from the avant-garde of the 20th century: Fauvism, Expressionism, Surrealism, Abstraction and Pop Art. We will be able to admire works by two of the main Spanish painters: Picasso and Dal. The opening of the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum in 1992 gave rise, by joining the Prado and Reina Sofa Museums, to the so-called Triangle of Art on Paseo del Prado, an area that concentrates the most important pictorial heritage in Spain, today recognized as World Heritage of the UNESCO.

data.name: Avila with Walls Access and Segovia Day Trip from Madrid
data.description: Check in at our office in central Madrid 15 minutes in advance of your tour. Leave the city towards Segovia aboard one of our air-conditioned coaches. Our first stop will be in the city of Segovia. Upon arrival, we will be divided into different groups. If you have chosen the Segovia at your own pace, you will enjoy approximately three hours of free time to visit the city on your own. If you have chosen the option with monuments, you will have access to the Alczar of Segovia, where you will enjoy a guided tour while you marvel at its spectacular fortification. Did you know that its architecture inspired Walt Disney for one of his films? Can you tell us which one? Walk through the old Jewish quarter of the city and visit the exterior of the Cathedral. Those who have the gastronomic menu included will head to the restaurant; to enjoy a typical local menu with roast suckling pig that will not leave you indifferent. After visiting Segovia, we will continue our tour to Avila, one of the best preserved fortified cities in Spain. Follow your guide on a guided tour of the old town to discover the city's impressive history. See Romanesque churches, Gothic palaces and a fortified cathedral from the middle Ages. Visit the walls of Avila as you imagine the stories they have seen through the centuries. Marvel at the fortification and towers, declared as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

data.name: Private Madrid Highlights Walking Tour
data.description: About During your stay in Madrid, you cant miss this amazing tour around its most representative attractions. Youll start at the emblematic Plaza Mayor, to take a walk around it. The squares origins date to the 16th century. In this square, also known as Plaza del Arrabal (suburbian square), is where the village market used to take place, building the first porched house to adjust the commerce at the square. From Plaza Mayor youll walk to Puerta del Sol, and enjoy a different perspective on this street as you take a look at the Metropolis building, one of the most representative symbols of Madrid. Youll also check on Gran Va, which is the most famous street in Madrid, as well as one of the most representative works in Spain. The next stop is the Cibeles fountain and the post office, current town hall. Youll walk through Puerta de Alcal, to next arrive in Parque del Retiro, where the tour ends. Meeting Point: Statue of Felipe III, in Plaza Mayor Inclusions: Private Guide Exclusions: Transportation Entrances to any monument

Next to Huertas Street, our stop goes into an old but renovated bar (or Casa de Comidas), to taste Meat cheeks, known as Carrilleraswith smashed potatoes and drinking a good wine, preferably red. The route continues walking through Plaza de Santa Ana and Spanish Theater, a lot of terraces in this area, and you will feel and be part of it. Our last tasting stop, deliver us a traditional Shrimp with Garlic served in terracotta or in a clay dish. After several typical tastings, can you think of a better ending than going up to a terrace with excellent views of Madrid to enjoy a cava glass? The experience keeps going after the tour head up to the rooftop, sip on a drink, and swap stories with fellow travelers. data.name: Madrid Highlights   Entrance to Prado Museum
data.description: Check in at our office and join us on the first part of the tour, a one-hour walking tour through the streets of the historic city center of Madrid. Discover emblematic places you cannot miss! Stroll around Plaza de la Villa, the famous Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol and Plaza de Oriente. Then board one of our air-conditioned buses for a ride through the city. Leave Plaza de Oriente and head to the magnificent Puerta de Toledo. Did you know its construction dates back from the Napoleonic era? See the oldest bridge in Madrid and drive next to the Manzanares River, from where you will have great views of the Royal Palace and the Almudena Cathedral. Pass by Mayor Street, Puerta del Sol square and the Las Cortes quarter on your way to the Paseo del Prado. Admire the architecture of the Old Madrid arriving into the Las Letras Quarter. Drive by Cibeles Fountain, where Real Madrid fans celebrate the team victories. Do not miss Puerta de Alcal, the most famous of the five ancient gates into the city. The last sights you will see on the tour are the Santiago Bernabu stadium through Paseo de la Castellana and Colon square. But no trip to Madrid would be completed without a visit to the Prado Museum. Immerse yourself in its impressive collection as you wander through its majestic rooms at your own pace. Discover some of the most influential paintings in history, created by geniuses such as El Bosco, El Greco, Velzquez, Goya and Rubens. Discover the aim of the original building and why it changed to hold one of the most important art galleries in the world. The current exhibition holds more than 1.000 paintings of four different centuries

data.name: Skip the Line: Guided tour Prado Museum
data.description: Meet your guide by the Madrid City Tour Information Center next to Prado Museum. Remember to check in 15 minutes in advance of your activity. Enjoy a guided tour without queues with your skip the line ticket. Visit the most important paintings throughout the Museum. Admire great artworks by el Bosco, el Greco, Velazquez, Goya and Rubens. Discover the aim of the original building and why it changed to hold one of the most important art galleries in the world. The current exhibition holds more than 1.000 paintings of four different centuries. Given that for a first time visitor this can be overwhelming, let your guide show you around the site and learn about some of the most important works and its backstories. Did you know the royal collection represents the museums foundation? Once your guided tour finishes you can stay inside the museum for as long as you wish

data.name: Fast Track Access to The Royal Palace
data.description: Skip the lines and get inside one of the most memorable Royal Castles of Europe! Duration 1.5 Hours The Royal Palace has the right to close due to an official event. About The Royal Palace of Madrid used to be the official residence of the Spanish Royal Family. Nowadays, the palace is also used exclusively for receptions, ceremonies, and official events. The Royal Palace is also called Palacio de Oriente, due to its proximity to the Plaza de Oriente square, which is on the east (Oriental) side of the palace. Our visit includes some of the most impressive rooms like the throne lounge, the gala dining room, the royal chapel or the parade ground. Highlights Professional guided tour. data.name: Madrid Segway TOP Highlights & Parque del Retiro
data.description: Explore Madrid on a guided two-and-a-half-hour segway tour. Discover the secrets of the "Madrid of the Austrians", see Almudena Cathedral, the Royal Palace, the Plaza Mayor, and Retiro Park, while learning more about the history & culture of the capital. ABOUT Come and enjoy the newest and safest model of Segway, the "Genuine i2 Segways". Always in the safety hands of your guide, in this experience you will discover how to use your authentic Segway in a magical atmosphere that only the Madrid skyline can create. Your tour will be adapted to your skills levels. If this is your first time, you need only 5 to 10 minutes to become an expert. After the training, we will show you the Madrid you want to see, including the main sights and secret nooks known only to the locals, such as the vantage point of the Mirador del Factor with its stunning panoramic views of the Almudena Cathedral and the Royal Palace, where the mountains make the perfect background. The tour will continue to the Almudena Cathedral. We will visit outside of the temple and discover that it holds the title of being the last Spanish cathedral to be completed, and is one of the few cathedrals in Spain to suffer the ravages of the civil war, before being finally consecrated less than 25 years ago. You will travel through Habsburg Madrid, the oldest part of Madrid, containing beautiful narrow streets reminiscent of Madrid's most ancient times. If you like longer tours, the Retiro Park is a perfect setting to feel how a perfect urban combination is created by the blend of city and nature. Glide through a green path of forests, historic gardens, parks and many more places to be discovered with the best guides on this Segway tour. Have fun and feel unique in your experience in a Premium Small Group tour. INCLUDES Professional Bilingual Guide to ensure a quality service and the greatest knowledge of the destination. data.name: Visita guiada del Palacio Real en ESPAOL
data.description: Visita la residencia oficial de los Reyes de Espaa, las zonas por donde pasean o donde toman el almuerzo. Te sorprender cada uno de sus rincones en esta visita de dos horas por el Palacio Real de Madrid. Uno de los palacios ms grandes de Europa que cuenta con ms de 2500 habitaciones, con instrumentos musicales Stradivarius con ms de 300 aos de vida o preciosos tapices bordados en la fbrica de tapices de Santa Brbara de Madrid. PUNTO DE ENCUENTRO: BUSCA NUESTRO PARAGUAS BLANCO Horario del Palacio Real A las 10:30 h. y a las 16:30 h. en CASTELLANO Duracin 90 minutos Acerca de Visita con nosotros el Palacio Real de Madrid y conocers la residencia de los Reyes de Espaa en este maravilloso tour. Conoceremos la gran escalera principal que nos lleva desde la entrada hasta los aposentos del Rey, donde en uno de ellos se realizan las reuniones internacionales del monarca Felipe VI con los mandatarios extranjeros que visitan nuestro pas. Posteriormente descubriremos las habitaciones ms privadas del Rey y la Reina junto al Gran Comedor de gala preparado para acoger 144 comensales. Las colecciones regias tambin incluyen una fantstica sala de porcelana y una espectacular capilla real cuyo fresco fue realizado por Corrado Giaquinto. El saln del trono ser nuestra ultima parada donde podremos admirar el maravilloso fresco de Giovanni Battista Tiepolo.

data.name: The best of Segovia with entrance to the Cathedral and the Alcazar
data.description: Starting from Madrid, we will head in the afternoon to Segovia, a small city that will surprise us from the moment we get off the bus. The walking tour will begin at the Alcazar of Segovia, one of the most famous and well-preserved medieval castles in the world. The Alcazar probably reminds you of some Disney castles, as its exterior architecture served as inspiration for some of Walt Disney's films, such as Cinderella's Castle or the Queen's Castle in Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. After the visit to the Alcazar, we will walk up to the Plaza Mayor, where we will find different monuments that will impress us, such as the Town Hall, the Juan Bravo Theatre and the Cathedral of Segovia, where we will have a complete guided tour of its interior. At the end of the visit to the Cathedral you will have some free time to enjoy Segovia at your leisure. At the appointed time, we will meet again at the Plaza Mayor. We will discover some of the city's monuments, such as the Casa de los Picos, whose faade has 617 granite peaks, or the Plaza Medina del Campo, where you will find the Church of San Martn, built in 1.117, and the Torren de Lozoya. We will finish the guided tour at the Aqueduct, one of the oldest monuments in Spain. With more than 16 kilometers long, it was built over 2.000 years ago. During the visit we will discover how it was built, in which no cement was used, as well as the route that the water took to reach Segovia.

data.name: Grand Flamenco Gala at the Teatro Capitol Gran Va in Madrid
data.description: A renowned flamenco gala, the most viewed flamenco showcase in Barcelona's history, is now arriving in Madrid. It provides audiences with an immersive exploration of flamenco, featuring everything they could envision about this art: castanets, fans, stunning and sensual dresses, and authentic music. In contrast to other tablaos, this show offers breathtaking choreographies, crafted by renowned Spanish dance companies.

data.name: Toledo Full Day Private Tour with tapas tasting
data.description: Relax and enjoy the scenery on the way to the city. Follow your local guide on a walking tour of the Historic City of Toledo, World Heritage City since 1986. Once Spains capital, it is a perfect mix of Arab, Jewish and Christian cultures. Learn about its fantastic heritage and see how the coexistence of cultures through the centuries influenced its current architectural style. Walk amid the courtyard cloisters and royal coats of arms at the San Juan de los Reyes Monastery. Admire the building sponsored by Queen Elizabeth from Castilla to become a royal mausoleum, the most important construction built by the Catholic Monarchs. Right after the visit we will walk to the Synagogue of Sta. Maria la Blanca. Originally built as a synagogue, it was expropriated and became a Church only 211 years after it opened its doors. Today, it is a fantastic museum of Mudejar (Arabic) style that you will visit. Admire the world-famous painting by el Greco The Burial of the Count of Orgaz at the Church of St. Tom. Did you know el Greco himself lived in this beautiful city? The next building that you will visit is the small church Cristo de luz. This building was one of the ten mosques that existed in the city and actually is the best preserved. It is now time to relish on a wonderful tapas menu for lunch at around 1PM. After that time, visit the Cathedral of Toledo. Considered one of the most important Gothic Cathedrals in Spain. Admire the stained-glass windows decorating the naves and discover the history of this great monument. See more than ten paintings by el Greco and wander around the location listening to your guide.

data.name: Private guided to Toledo including Cathedral with Madrid hotel pick up
data.description: Dive into its history and discover a perfect mix of Arab, Jewish and Christian cultures. Wander around its Old Town, declared a World Heritage City in 1986. The more than 2000 years of existence have given the city a huge historical importance. Did you know it once was the capital of Spain? Get to know the city fantastic heritage and discover how the coexistence of the three cultures throughout the centuries influenced its current architectural style. Follow your guide through the city-cobbled streets until you reach the Cathedral. Built on the remains of an Arab mosque, its construction started in the 13th century. Today, it is one of the most important Gothic Cathedrals of Spain. Admire the magnificent faade and the huge bell tower before getting inside. Visit its interior and Sacristy, full of masterpieces of the former art museum it was. Amongst them, see fifteen paintings by El Greco.

After visiting the Las Letras, La Latina & Austrias village, you will enjoy an intimate flamenco show surrounded by the amazing atmosphere of The Tablao Flamenco, a hidden treasure from in the center of Madrid. data.name: The Three Tenors in Madrid
data.description: The enchanting voices of the three tenors Francesco Fortes, Alessandro Fortunato and Stefano Sorrentino, accompanied by strings and piano, guide listeners through the masterpieces of Italian opera, timeless Neapolitan songs, and the passionate melodies of Spanish tradition. The concert begins with iconic arias and classical pieces from Carmen, Tosca, Turandot, and Rigoletto. The second part features unforgettable pieces like 'O sole mio, Torna a Surriento, Bsame mucho, and Historia de un amor, climaxing in a crescendo of emotion and passion. In the first part, the tenors present the eternal emotion of the greatest opera ever, while the second part enlivens the audience with the warmth, rhythm, and intensity of beloved masterpieces from around the world. A varied, dynamic, and unforgettable concert is framed by the wonderful location of the splendid Ctedra Mayor of Ateneo de Madrid. Program First Part: Georges Bizet: Habanera Carmen Gaetano Donizetti: Una furtiva lagrima LElisir damore Giacomo Puccini: E lucevan le stelle Tosca Ruggero Leoncavallo: Mattinata Astor Piazzolla - Ave Maria Giuseppe Verdi: La donna mobile Rigoletto Augustin Lara - Granada Giacomo Puccini: Nessun dorma Turandot Second Part: Medley de Canciones Napolitanas - Arreglo de Elvin Dhimitri Ernesto De Curtis, Torna a Surriento Enrico Cannio, 'O surdato 'nnammurato Domenico Modugno, Nel blu dipinto di blu Consuelo Velzquez, Besame mucho Andrea Bocelli, Con te partir Carlos Eleta Almarn, Historia de un amor Lucio Dalla, Caruso Alfredo Le Pera, Por una cabeza Eduardo di Capua, O Sole mio El Ateneo de Madrid - Ctedra Mayor Madrid's Ateneo is the foremost private cultural institution in contemporary Spanish history, fostering sciences, arts, and letters since 1820. Architects Enrique Fort and Luis Landecho designed it. The narrow faade, featuring three medallions of Alfonso X the Wise, Cervantes, and Velzquez, belies the building's spacious interior. Its facilities include reading rooms, a lecture hall, and a grand neo-Grecian auditorium by Arturo Mlida. The Athenaeum played a vital role in 19th and early 20th-century Spain as a forum for debate and a stage for free expression. The 'cacharrera' (junk room) hosted lively discussions among writers and artists, extending from afternoon till late night. Notable members include Mesonero Romanos, Castelar, Cnovas del Castillo, Unamuno, Valle-Incln, and Manuel Azaa. The portrait collection, with works by Rosales and Madrazo, interests many, but the priceless book collection in its library, open to the public until after midnight, is even more significant, housing over 200,000 volumes.

data.name: From Madrid: Puy du Fou Espaa + Sueo de Toledo
data.description: Visit Puy du Fou, a theme park known for its shows representing the history of Spain located in Toledo. From Madrid, you'll travel in our comfortable coach to the spectacular Puy du Fou park, where you'll enter a world of adventures, historical characters and special effects. One of the park's most famous attractions are its marvelous shows suitable for the whole family, where acts of famous characters from Spanish history are represented, such as The Cid Campeador, Cristobal Colon or Lope de Vega. There is also an aerial exhibition with more than 200 birds of prey and equestrian shows. In addition to all this, you can sample a wide variety of typical Spanish gastronomy in its various restaurants. As a final touch, you will enjoy the impressive night show "El Sueo de Toledo", in which more than 200 actors and horsemen represent 1500 years of history on a huge stage. At the end of the day, after the show, you'll return to Madrid with the feeling of having traveled back in time - an experience you'll want to repeat! Highlights Immerse yourself in the History of Spain through the park's atmosphere Enjoy the more than 7 shows that are performed in the park Try the typical Spanish gastronomy in its numerous taverns Be thrilled by "El Sueo de Toledo", the biggest show in Spain Included Transportation from the meeting point Access to Puy du Fou Espaa park Entrance to "El Sueo de Toledo" show Priority seating in "El Sueo de Toledo" show Excluded Hotel pick up and drop off Food and beverages "Emocion Pass" Meeting Point The bus will be waiting at Canovas del Castillo Square, next to the Neptuno Fountain in front of "Caseta de informacin turstica". You can find it by introducing ""Caseta de informacin turstica Neptuno" in Google Maps Important The return to Madrid will be at approximately 23:15, when "El Sueo de Toledo" show ends, arriving at 00:30.

data.name: The Best of Madrid: Private Half-Day Tour including Prado Museum
data.description: Explore the highlights of Madrid, Spains historic, vibrant and beautiful capital city on this half-day private walking tour, including entrance to the iconic Prado Museum. On your private tour, you will: See the main attractions of Madrid as you learn about the fascinating history of the city; Learn about the history of the Spanish royal family and its links to the Papacy as you stand outside the Palacio Real, the royal palace considered the most important Baroque palace in Spain; See the astonishing Catedral de la Almudena; Stop by famous monuments and wander down elegant boulevards; Explore Plaza de Oriente, Teatro Real and the Market of San Miguel; Experience the grandeur and elegant atmosphere of the iconic Plaza Mayor, the beating heart of Madrid; Admire the myriad of stunning architectural styles in Madrid, from Baroque to Spanish Gothic; Enjoy a guided walk around the beautifully manicured Parque El Retiro; Arrive at the Prado Museum, and enjoy a guided visit to this treasure trove of art; Admire the world-famous Spanish masters such as Bosch, Goya, El Greco, and Diego Velazquez; End your tour inside the museum, to continue at your own leisure. Madrid, Spain's stunning capital, is a vibrant city famous for its elegant boulevards and vast, dazzling Plazas like the portico-lined Plaza Mayor, in the heart of old Hapsburg Madrid. Youll see vibrant food markets, awe-inspiring cathedrals, and statues of famous Spaniards. The city is also very green with expansive, manicured parks such as the Parque el Retiro, where you will enjoy a stroll along as you bask in the sunny Spanish climate under fabulous blue skies! Spain has one of the oldest and proudest royal families in Europe, and it remains a working monarchy to this day. Learn all about the history of the Spanish royals, like Ferdinand and Isabella, Philip II and many others, whilst standing in front of the magnificent Royal Palace. The city is also famous for being a cultural hub and is home to several museums the most famous of which is of course the Prado, and your half-day highlights tour includes a fully guided tour of this repository of the best of Spanish art. Admire works by Goya and Velazquez, Bosch and El Greco among others and let your guide know if you have any favourites or must-sees. You will end your tour inside the Prado to continue exploring at your leisure, explore the gift shop and enjoy a well-earned coffee break at the caf.

data.name: Museos Reina Sofa y Thyssen con almuerzo en ESPAOL
data.description: Con esta visita guiada de 5 horas, con almuerzo incluido, podr conocer junto a su gua dos de los museos ms importantes de Espaa: el Museo Reina Sofa, donde su gua le explicar el Guernica de Picasso, y el Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza. Adems, disfrutar de un paseo guiado entre ambos espacios. PUNTO DE ENCUENTRO: Museo Reina Sofa. Acceso de grupos, situado en el edificio Nouvel, junto a la escultura Lichtenstein. El gua lleva paraguas blanco Horario de la visita Viernes y sbados a las 13:00 h. en ESPAOL Duracin 5 horas Acerca de En este tour se incluyen las visitas guiadas de dos de los museos ms importantes del pas: el Museo Reina Sofa, y el Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza. El Museo Reina Sofa tiene el honor de albergar y conservar uno de los cuadros ms importantes del siglo XX: el Guernica de Picasso, una obra maestra que le estremecer con tan solo mirarlo, por sus dimensiones y su espectacularidad, y an le impactar ms cuando su gua le explique sus smbolos y detalles ocultos. Este ao 2023 se conmemora el 50 aniversario de la muerte de su autor, por lo que merece toda nuestra atencin. El Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza cuenta con cerca de mil obras que abarcan desde el siglo XIII hasta el XX, han convertido este museo en uno de los ms destacados a nivel internacional. La Coleccin incluye artistas de la talla de Tiziano, Rubens, Rembrandt, Caravaggio, Manet, Renoir, Van Gogh, Gauguin, Kandinsky, Hopper o Picasso.

data.description: Descubra en este tour privado de 4 horas el Palacio Real, considerado el palacio real ms grande de Europa, y la nueva Galera de Colecciones Reales, que alberga 650 obras de enorme relevancia. Su gua le mostrar las estancias y obras ms destacadas, y le har entender la historia de Espaa a travs de ambos espacios. Punto de encuentro: Plaza de Isabel II, tambin conocida como Plaza de pera Horario A determinar por el cliente. Duracin: 4 horas Acerca de En el Palacio Real, actualmente utilizado para ceremonias de Estado y actos solemnes, su gua le mostrar las principales estancias. Cuenta con ms de 2500 habitaciones, posee instrumentos musicales Stradivarius con ms de 300 aos de vida, y preciosos tapices bordados en la fbrica de tapices de Santa Brbara de Madrid, entra otras maravillas. Conoceremos la gran escalera principal que nos lleva desde la entrada hasta los aposentos del Rey, donde en uno de ellos se realizan las reuniones internacionales del monarca Felipe VI con los mandatarios extranjeros que visitan nuestro pas. Posteriormente descubriremos las habitaciones ms privadas del Rey y la Reina junto al Gran Comedor de gala preparado para acoger 144 comensales. Las colecciones regias tambin incluyen una fantstica Sala de porcelana y una espectacular Capilla real cuyo fresco fue realizado por Corrado Giaquinto. El Saln del trono ser nuestra ltima parada donde podremos admirar el maravilloso fresco de Giovanni Battista Tiepolo. Despus se dirigirn a la nueva Galera de Colecciones Reales, el proyecto musestico ms importante en Espaa en dcadas. Disfrute de un recorrido por la cultura en un edificio excepcional, a travs de una seleccin de ms de 650 obras de enorme relevancia, entre las que destacan pinturas, esculturas, armaduras, tapices, artes decorativas o carrozas firmadas por maestros de la talla de El Greco, Caravaggio, Velzquez, Tiepolo o Goya.

data.name: Guided tour of the Reina Sofia Museum in ENGLISH. SMALL GROUP
data.description: Enjoy a semi-private visit with small groups of up to 7 people in a single language. Use of radio guides to clearly hear the guide's explanations. Be impressed by the magnitude of Pablo Picasso's Guernica. Learn all the most unique details of surrealism by admiring the works of Dal. Immerse yourself in the evolution of modern Spanish art. MEETING POINT: Museo Reina Sofa. Group entrance, located in the Nouvel building, next to the Lichtenstein sculpture. The guide carries a white umbrella Guided tour schedule Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays at 1:00 p.m. Thursdays and Saturdays at 16:00 hrs in ENGLISH Duration 90 minutes About The Reina Sofa is the southern vertex of the renowned Art Triangle of Madrid, which includes two other famous museums: the Prado and the Thyssen-Bornemisza. The museum's permanent collection features a core of works by great Spanish artists of the 20th century, especially Pablo Picasso, Salvador Dal, and Joan Mir, who are extensively represented with some of their best works. In this museum, you will discover one of the masterpieces of the 20th century: Guernica by Pablo Picasso. Your guide will reveal the secrets and symbols hidden in this impressive painting.

data.name: Private Madrid at Sunset
data.description: About Get to know the most important places in Madrid as night falls. Meet and take unique pictures of the main buildings at night and enjoy a different way of appreciating the city. We will start our visit at the Plaza pera and from there we will go to the iconic Royal Palace in Madrid to get a panoramic view of this wonderful place and have the opportunity to take good pictures from the outside. Then we will go to Madrid de los Austrias, passing by the Puente de Segovia, the Plaza de la Villa, the Plaza Mayor and ending at the Puerta del Sol. With this tour you will get to know the most important points of historical Madrid and learn about the daily life of the people who live in this city. Let yourself be surprised by the colourful and spectacular lighting of the city. In addition, you will have the opportunity to get to know some of the restaurants and bars in the area so that you can find out what the nightlife is like in Madrid. Our guide will give you some recommendations, so that, if you wish, you can stay for dinner or have a few drinks (on your own) and continue enjoying the night in Madrid. Inclusions: Private Guide Exclusions: Transportation Entrances to any monument

data.name: Madrid Highlights and Skip the Line Guided tour Royal Palace
data.description: Check in at our office and join us on the first part of the tour, a one hour walking tour through the streets of the historic city center of Madrid. Discover emblematic places you cannot miss! Stroll around Plaza de la Villa, the famous Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol and Plaza de Oriente. Then board one of our air-conditioned buses for a ride through the city. Remember to bring your camera or Smartphone! Leave Plaza de Oriente and head to the magnificent Puerta de Toledo. Did you know its construction dates back from the Napoleonic era? See the oldest bridge in Madrid and drive next to the Manzanares River, from where you will have great views of the Royal Palace and the Almudena Cathedral. Pass by Mayor Street, Puerta del Sol square and the Las Cortes quarter on your way to the Paseo del Prado. Admire the architecture of the Old Madrid arriving into the Las Letras Quarter. Drive by Cibeles Fountain, where Real Madrid fans celebrate the team victories. Do not miss Puerta de Alcal, the most famous of the five ancient gates into the city. The last sights you will see on the tour are the Santiago Bernabu stadium through Paseo de la Castellana street and Colon square. But no trip to Madrid would be completed without a visit to the Royal Palace. Thus, a local guide will pick you up from our office for a guided visit to the same. Skip the lines and dive right into the history of this beautiful palace. Did you know its size doubles the one of Buckingham Palace? Build in an Italian baroque style, it was the former residence of the Spanish Monarchy from 1766 to 1931. Nowadays, it still is a great example of the establishment of Madrid as the capital of the kingdom. Today, it holds the most important receptions of the Spanish Crown. Know the audiences, dinner parties and signature of agreements celebrated through the years. Walk around the Armory Square. Marvel at the beautiful tapestries and elegant furniture. Follow your guide through the Grand Staircase, the Throne Room and the Banqueting Hall, among others. Once your guided visit finishes, you can stay inside the Palace and go to the Royal Armory on your own.

data.name: Private guided tour to Royal Monastery of El Escorial and Valley of the Fallen
data.description: Enjoy a guided tour through the Royal Monastery of El Escorial, an architectural ensemble declared World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Built in the 15th century, it is a symbol of the power of the government at the time. Learn about the impressive Royal Mausoleum it contains and the story behind the 21 years it took to build the site. Of Renaissance style, you will marvel at the building symmetry. Listen to your guide explanations as you walk along the site visiting the Habsburgs Palace, the Chapter House, the Basilica and the remarkable library. Board your private car again at the end of the guided tour for a short drive to the Valley of the Fallen. The site is located 9km away from El Escorial, in Sierra de Guadarrama. You will be able to see it from far away thanks to the monumental cross built above the site. The monument is an underground church built into the mountain. The same is topped by the Worlds Largest Cross, which can be seen from miles away.

data.name: "Skip The Line" Royal Palace   Prado Museum
data.description: Start your visit by entering the Royal Palace of Madrid without queuing up. The Royal Palace, which was built in the 18th century in a classicist Baroque with an Italian style, is located at the same place where the Alczar of the Habsburgs used to stand. It covers an area of 135,000 square metres, almost twice as large as Buckingham Palace or the Palace of Versailles, making it the largest palace in Western Europe, as well as one of the largest in the world. Although it is no longer the official residence of the Spanish monarchy, the most important receptions of the Royal Crown are currently held inside. During the guided tour, you will have the opportunity to see the Main Square, the Grand Staircase, the flats of King Charles III, the Queen's flats, the banqueting hall, the royal chapel, the throne room and the crown room. At the end of the visit inside the Royal Palace, we will take a walk of approximately one hour that will take us, accompanied by our guide, to the Prado Museum. The museum's current collection is made up of more than 1.000 works from four different centuries. Discover the works of artists such as Velzquez, Goya, Sorolla, El Greco and El Bosco

data.name: Private visit to Segovia from Madrid with Cathedral and Alcazar
data.description: Enjoy a half day guided tour and discover the city. Stroll through its old town, declared a World Heritage Site in 1985 and see its famous roman aqueduct. Admire the monument, considered the most important roman civil engineering construction in Spain. Follow your guide through the streets and see the amazing Cathedral of Segovia. Later, continue through the Jewish Quarter towards the Alcazar of Segovia. Enjoy a guided visit of the site and marvel at this spectacular fortification. Did you know its architecture served as inspiration in some Walt Disney films? Once you finish the visit, board a private vehicle back again for the return trip to Madrid.

data.name: Private Full Day tour to Toledo with wine tasting
data.description: On this tour, we will have the opportunity to discover the city of the three cultures, Toledo. Accompanied all time with your guide, who will pick you up at the hotel in Madrid, you will discover the most important places of the city. The first stop will undoubtedly surprise you, as it will be at the Mirador del Valle, from where you will have the best view of Toledo. Its privileged location will allow you to see the city from the heights, where the Alczar will stand out. Once you have been able to see Toledo from the heights, we will head towards the city, where we will begin a walking tour of the most outstanding monuments, such as the Cathedral, the Church of Santo Tom, the Plaza de Zocodover or the Synagogue of Santa Mara la Blanca, which we will have the opportunity to see inside. At the end of this walking tour, you will have free time for lunch. If you don't know where to eat, your guide will be able to tell you about the traditional food of Toledo as well as the best places to try it. After lunch, we will visit a Premium winery located very close to Toledo, where we will have the opportunity to discover three wines that will surely surprise you. This tasting will be accompanied by local cold meats and cheeses. Once we have finished the visit to the winery, it will be time to return to Madrid, where we will finish in the same place where we started the visit, your hotel.

data.description: Con este tour guiado de 5 horas descubrir dos de los lugares imprescindibles de Madrid: el Museo del Prado y el Palacio Real. Horario de la visita Martes, jueves y sbados a las 13:00 en ESPAOL Acerca de Comenzaremos nuestra visita en el Museo del Prado, donde el gua le mostrar las obras ms representativas de esta prestigiosa pinacoteca. Admiraremos pinturas de grandes maestros como Velzquez, El Greco, Goya, Rubens y El Bosco, mientras descubre la historia detrs de cada obra. A continuacin, pasearemos hacia el Palacio Real, recorriendo en el camino algunas de las zonas ms destacadas del centro histrico. Ya en el Palacio, exploraremos sus majestuosos salones: el Comedor de Gala, la Sala de la Corona y el Saln del Trono, entre otros. Nuestro gua le acompaar durante toda la experiencia para asegurarle una visita enriquecedora y amena.

data.name: The Four Seasons by Vivaldi in Madrid
data.description: Witness the evocative power of Antonio Vivaldi's 'The Four Seasons' performed by strings quintet and harpsichord in the extraordinary location of Ctedra Mayor of Ateneo de Madrid. The most famous of Vivaldis works, and a revolutionary example of Italian Baroque music. Music representing the moods of the four seasons has always been popular, and Baroque composers such as Werner and Fischer among others produced cycles of concertos representing the fours seasons. But none were to do so in such precise pictorial detail as Antonio Vivaldi in his Four Seasons concerto. The whole Baroque epoch showed a deep interest in the amazing natural changes determined by the seasons. Bernini itself represented them in its fine sculptures. Baroque art has a dramatic conception of the relationship between man and nature and between man and the universe. Galileos discoveries brought about a shift in the position of man, who was no longer at the center of the cosmos. As a consequence, a new attitude of awe and wonder towards the power of nature emerged. Vivaldis Four Seasons are a symbol of his era. Not only is the feeling of astonishment conveyed by his spectacular description of nature, but also by his musical language. The composition aims at astounding the listener with unusual melodies, created through increased rhythm and higher harmonic contrast. His music is thus freer, more fluid and able to better describe the story it wishes to narrate. The scenes range from the chirp of different birds in Spring, to Summer storms, from fleeing foxes in Autumn, to teeth chattering and rain pouring down in Winter. In accordance with the highest expression of baroque concepts, nature is dramatized, and the audience feels actively involved in the rapid succession of events taking place in the work of art.

data.name: Madrid Tapas Adventure
data.description: In Spain, tapas are more than just foodthey're a social and cultural activity meant to be enjoyed in company. Some are elaborate plates full of food; others are bite-sized dishes of olives or potato chips. Some are hot; some are cold. Rather than sitting at a table, people commonly eat their tapas standing up at the bar or at small tables. It stands to reason, because tapas are informal, and the bars are often busy. Your tapas adventure begins in Plaza de la Villa, the old main square in central Madrid. After a brief introduction to the city and its tapas credentials, well head towards Mercado de San Miguel, the first gourmet market in all of Spain and liveliest culinary spots in the city. While walking alongside stalls and tapas bars offering a wide variety of treats you will learn about the importance of Spanish market culture. From there we will hear to local tavern under Plaza Mayor, where well start with an aperitivo, what else?! Spain is a well-known cheese producing nation, offering the world such cheesy delights as manchego. Well try some delicious Spanish cheese and the famous tortilla de patata, alongsidea glass of vermouth of course Next, well head to the pulsating barrio La Latina to explore its narrow lanes and fascinating history. This neighbourhood is ultra trendy right now and is popular with locals for its vibrant food and drink scene. We will stop at the tavern, where you will have a chance to taste a very local liquor that any lover of Madrid knows about. The Madroo goes well together with some red meat, so let`s taste some Spanish Chorizo. From there, we will head back to the oldest part of Madrid, as we walk, well continue to chat about the citys history and food culture. Our next food stop, right in the heart of Plaza Mayor is to try the iconic bocadillo de calamares, the famous sandwich of the city. To wash it down, well try some local beer too! Back on the streets, your local guide will point out interesting sights and alternative food and drink stops for you to explore on your own as we head to our penultimate foodie highlight of the day. The perfect snack at any time of day are the shrimps. Well try some of Madrids most famous shrimps together with some Spanish house wine, red or white is you to choose from. After that we will walk towards Puerta del Sol, one of the most iconic spots of Madrid and finish our tapas adventure with a local dessert. Once youve finished your dessert, your guide will take you back to Puerta del Sol, where they can help you out with directions back to your accommodation or ideas on where to go next! There may be a change of itinerary according to opening times of bars and restaurants along the way depending on how crowded they are. However, all the bars you are taken to are of the same standard, so you will not be missing out if the itinerary does change. Food inclusions are subject to change, dependent on availability on the day. Please note that this tour covers 1.6 km (1 mile) of walking.

Enjoy your visit through the Royal Monastery of El Escorial, an architectural ensemble declared World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Built in the 16th century, it is a symbol of the power of the government at the time. Accompanied by your guide, you will discover the most important areas of the monument. Of Renaissance style, you will marvel at the building symmetry as you walk along the site visiting the Habsburgs Palace, the Chapter House, the Basilica and the remarkable library. If you have chosen the option with a visit to the Valley of the Fallen, get back on the bus for the short journey to the next destination. The Valley of the Fallen is located 9km away from El Escorial, in Sierra de Guadarrama. You will be able to see it from far away thanks to the monumental cross built above the site. The monument is an underground church built into the mountain. The same is topped by the Worlds Largest Cross, which can be seen from miles away

data.description: Visita el Madrid de los Borbones y conoce la historia de Madrid y de Espaa de la mano de nuestro gua, quien te ensear tambin el parque de todos los madrileos: el parque del Retiro. Secretos y ancdotas locales te esperan en el atardecer madrileo. Adems terminaremos la visita disfrutando de un espectculo flamenco junto a una copa de vino. Duracin 3.5 Horas Acerca de Con nuestro tour Esta Noche Madrid disfrutars de un paseo al atardecer por el Madrid de los Borbones, edificado al gusto del Rey Carlos III el mejor alcalde de Madrid! el cual nos ha legado enclaves nicos de la ciudad donde conocers ancdotas y misterios. Adems del saln del Prado, disfrutaremos del Tringulo del Arte, conocido por ser el lugar donde ms arte se concentra por metro cuadrado en Madrid y terminars la velada asistiendo a un Espectculo Flamenco. En esta visita guiada por Madrid, descubriremos el Cacadero ms popular de los Reyes en Madrid y actual parque de todos los madrileos, sumergindonos en la plaza donde se celebra el Ao Nuevo: La Puerta del Sol. Esta visita guiada auspiciada por el atardecer madrileo te sumergir en sus largas calles y cntricas plazas donde podrs disfrutar del ambiente nocturno de la ciudad y disfrutar de la urbe que nunca descansa. data.name: Private tour: ''Skip the line'' Guided Tour Royal Palace
data.description: Head to the Royal Palace with your guide, skip the lines and dive right into the history of this beautiful palace. Did you know its size doubles the one of Buckingham Palace? Build in an Italian baroque style, it was the former residence of the Spanish Monarchy from 1766 to 1931. Nowadays, it still is a great example of the establishment of Madrid as the capital of the kingdom. Today, it holds the most important receptions of the Spanish Crown. Know the audiences, gala dinners and signature of agreements celebrated through the years. Walk around the Armory Square. Marvel at the beautiful tapestries and elegant furniture. Follow your guide through the Grand Staircase, the Throne Room and the Banqueting Hall, among others.

data.name: Escape the Inquisition in Madrid Exploration Game
data.description: Avoid tiresome and disengaging group tours and inject some fun into your vacation with this self-guided discovery tour of Madrid. Using an interactive city exploration app on your phone, solve clues to uncover the stories of hidden gems and iconic sights. + Discover Madrid's historical wonders, iconic sights, and hidden gems + Walk the charming streets of La Latina, bursting with popular tapas restaurants + Learn about Madrid's turbulent history as you unlock a series of puzzles + Have fun with your travel buddies and explore the city at the same time On your own, with friends, or with family, make the most of your vacation and discover the historical wonders of Madrid on this fun-filled discovery game and tour. The exploration app provides all the directions you need for the adventure, so you wont have to wait around for guide or rely on maps and GPS.

data.name: Spanish Traditional Villages & Winery Visit with Wine Tasting and Tapas Lunch
data.description: duration: 6,5 hours cancellation_summary: 24 hours free of charge. Less than 24 hours or No Show 100%. meeting_point: Plaza San Miguel 7, 28005 Madrid max_age: 99 group_size: 22 pricing: From 179,99 description: Discover Madrids rich heritage with a visit to the charming village of Chinchn, explore the UNESCO World Heritage site or Aranjuez and its stunning gardens, and enjoy a wine tasting at a prestigious winery paired with traditional Spanish tapas for an unforgettable journey. Have fun and feel unique on a Premium Small Group Tour. Embark on an exclusive and unique journey through the history, culture, and flavors of Madrid in a premium small group experience. Spain's soul is intertwined with its wines, each bottle a testament to time, tradition, and terroir. Our 7-hour tour from Madrid promises not just a tasting, but a deep dive into this vinous legacy. Our adventure begins in the charming traditional village of Chinchn, renowned for its picturesque Plaza Mayor and authentic atmosphere. Immerse yourself in its rural charm as you explore cobblestone streets and historical monuments. Next, we head to Aranjuez, a UNESCO World Heritage city famed for its magnificent gardens and majestic Royal Palace. Stroll through the lush gardens, soaking in their beauty and tranquility while learning about the rich history that surrounds them. To culminate this unforgettable experience, we will visit a prestigious winery with a Designation of Origin from Madrid. And here, in its heart, there is a Winery with an extensive 400-hectare estate in Aranjuez, a UNESCO World Heritage City, where you will discover 14 hectares of organic vineyards featuring Tempranillo, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot, and Petit Verdot grape varieties, cultivated using environmentally friendly biodynamic practices. Our small, state-of-the-art winery crafts artisanal wines aged in French oak barrels. Experience the essence of nature in every bottle. Here, we will enjoy a wine tasting session featuring various varieties, each paired with a selection of traditional tapas from authentic Spanish rural cuisine. Delight your senses with the exquisite flavors of local wines and freshly prepared tapas. what_is_included: Expert guide well-versed in Spain's wine history and culture Comfortable Air-conditioned transportation to and from Madrid Visit to the traditional village of Chinchn Visit to a UNESCO site: Aranjuez and its gardens Visit to a vineyard, winery tour, and wine tasting paired with a light lunch of various tapas what_is_not_included: Tips (optional) Meals and drinks Hotel pick up itinerary: 09:15 - Meeting time at Plaza de San Miguel, 7. 09:30 - Departure from Madrid to Chinchon 10:30 - Arrival in Chinchon 11:30 - Departure to Aranjuez 12:20 - Arrival in Aranjuez - 45 min - Passing in front of the Royal Gardens. 13:00 - Departure to the Winery 13:15 - Arrival at the Winery - 2hrs 15:30 - Departure for Madrid 16:00 - Arrival in Madrid highlights: Visit to the charming traditional village of Chinchn Exploration of Aranjuez, a UNESCO World Heritage city and stroll through the magnificent gardens of Aranjuez Delight yourself by tasting certified wines with a D.O from Madrid and a traditional tapas lunch Artisanal Winery: Journey through a small, cutting-edge winery, where tradition meets innovation, producing handcrafted wines aged in French oak barrels. Unravel the story of Spanish wine, with its deep roots, diverse flavors, and timeless allure. check_in_details: Please, be at the check in point 15 minutes before departure time. special_requirements: You are kindly requested to inform of any nutritional requirement (diet, allergies, etc.) at the time of booking the tour and at the check-in. restrictions: There is a mnimum of people required to operate the tour.
