data.name: Paseo del Arte Card: Prado, Reina Sofa and Thyssen
data.shortDescription: Skip the line and save up to 20% at Madrid's top three museums
data.description:
Heighten your appreciation of Madrid with this skip-the-line Paseo del Arte Card and get speedy access to three of Madrid's best art museums; the Prado, Reina Sofa and Thyssen. They're all in close proximity and form what's known as the _Golden Triangle of Art_  home to the highest concentration of art in Europe.

Get access to the permanent collection of the Thyssen, and the permanent collection _plus_ some temporary exhibitions at both the Prado and Reina Sofa.

data.name: Museo Nacional Thyssen-Bornemisza: Permanent Collection
data.shortDescription: Visit one of the most impressive art collections on Earth
data.description:
Make time in Madrid to see this spectacular collection of art, and then silently thank German-Hungarian industrialist Baron Heinrich Thyssen-Bornemisza de Kszon for making art collecting his hobby. Book this open-dated ticket and visit whenever you like!

The name may be hard to pronounce, but don't let that stop you from making your way to the Museo Nacional Thyssen-Bornemisza. It's one of the most extraordinary art collections in the world, and also one of the largest.

Many of the big names are here, sometimes represented by just one painting. Start on the top floor and work your way down. Travel through history, from medieval art on the second floor through Impressionism, Post-Impressionism, and Expressionism on the first floor, all the way to Pop Art and the avant-garde on the ground floor.

data.name: Madrid: Guided Tuk Tuk Tour + Roundtrip Transfer
data.shortDescription: Ride an electric tuk-tuk and hear stories from a local guide
data.description:
Ride through Madrid in an electric tuk-tuk. 
 
This guided tour takes you through the city's historic center, landmarks and key neighborhoods in an electric vehicle, perfect for navigating the narrow streets. 

Along the way, your local guide will share stories and facts, with stops at popular spots for photos.

data.name: Madrid: Flamenco Show at Teatro Flamenco
data.shortDescription: Prepare to discover the raw essence of pure flamenco
data.description:
Teatro Flamenco Madrid is a theatre in the city center where you can experience flamenco up close. The theatre offers live performances that focus on the music and dance of southern Spain. 

It is a welcoming space where anyone can come to enjoy authentic flamenco. Teatro Flamenco Madrid is open to everyone who wants to learn more about this unique art form and share the experience with others.

data.name: Madrid Highlights Tour & Royal Palace: Skip The Line + Guided Tour
data.shortDescription: Get to know Madrid's most emblematic spots and its magnificient Royal Palace
data.description:
Get a crash course in Madrid's essential cultural heritage, on a city-center walking tour and delve into some remarkable royal history at the Royal Palace of Madrid. 

Discover emblematic places, iconic landmarks and the stories behind them as you wander the historic center of Madrid. Then, board an air-conditioned sightseeing bus see some of the most important sights such as Plaza Mayor, Puerta de Alcal, the Cibeles fountain, among others. 

No trip to Madrid is complete without a visit to the Royal Palace. Skip the lines and dive right into the history of this stunning royal residence with your guide. Twice the size of Buckingham Palace, this Baroque masterpiece was the official residence of the Spanish Monarchy from 1766 to 1931. It remains a  symbol of the establishment of Madrid as the capital of the Spanish kingdom. Walk the Grand Staircase, the Throne Room, the Banqueting Hall, and more. Once your guided visit finishes, you can stay explore the Royal Armory on your own.

data.name: Royal Palace of Madrid: Skip The Line Entry + Small Group Afternoon Guided Tour
data.shortDescription: Learn about Spanish royalty and see amazing artworks
data.description:
Join a small-group tour of the Royal Palace of Madrid. Skip the lines and learn more about the palace's rich history, architecture, and cultural highlights.

Hear your guide sharing insights into the building's significance and role in Spain's monarchy. Visit notable rooms and admire the artwork without waiting in long queues.

data.name: Madrid: Guided Spanish Cuisine Tour
data.shortDescription: Taste olives and cured meats at a market, then try a fried calamari sandwich
data.description:
Start your Madrid food tour by trying churros and chocolate at a neighborhood caf (only for morning tours). For the 5 pm tours, begin at a tapas bar with two classic bites and a cold beer.

Follow locals as they pick up fresh bread from a small bakery run by a northern Spanish baker. Learn why great bread is rare in Madrid and taste a chorizo-stuffed roll.

Head to the Mercado de Antn Martn. Taste olives, cured meats, fresh produce, and extra virgin olive oil. Sip red vermouth while learning about this aperitif.

Visit a deli and enjoy a cheese tasting with two Spanish wines. Try Madrids famous fried calamari sandwich standing outside the bar like a local.

Finish at a royal pastry shop from 1855.

data.name: Madrid: 1-Hr Guided Electric Tuk Tuk Tour
data.shortDescription: Discover the real Madrid on an electric tuk-tuk tour
data.description:
Discover Madrid on a tour that captures the city's true essence. Admire the Royal Palace and the Almudena Cathedral's impressive architecture. Take in the cultural richness of Barrio de Las Letras, a neighborhood known for its artistic flair. Witness the Parliament and the fascinating Paseo de Recoletos.

Check out the iconic Puerta de Alcal and wander through the Salamanca district, famous for its shops and the aesthetic appeal of its buildings and streets.

Furthermore, visit the Canalejas Center, a new symbol of international luxury in Madrid. Explore the urban landscape and get a glimpse into the daily life of this unique city.

data.name: Museo Thyssen: Art & Brunch
data.shortDescription: Plan a day at the Museo Thysse, starting with a delicious brunch
data.description:
Experiencing the Museo Thyssen with all five senses is now possible thanks to the new art and brunch experience, a combination allowing you to enjoy a delicious brunch every Saturday and Sunday from 11:00 to 13:00. This new experience includes a set menu designed especially for the occasion.

Art and gastronomy come together allowing you to round off your visit to the museum with a full array of flavors, which begin with a pastry basket and a selection of bread as well as a delicious yogurt with different freeze-dried red berry fruit toppings, fresh fruit and cold cuts, including delicacies such as Iberian pork shoulder and Mortadella Bologna. Natural grated tomato, artisanal jam, extra virgin olive oil, and cane syrup will also be available on your table, together with fresh orange juice and coffee or your favorite tea.

data.name: La Latina Madrid: Guided Morning Food Tour
data.shortDescription: Taste churros with hot chocolate and visit a popular tapas bar
data.description:
Take a two-hour guided food tour through La Latina, one of Madrids most vibrant neighborhoods. Known for its lively atmosphere and great local food, La Latina is a favorite spot for both residents and visitors.

Start your tour with a classic Madrid breakfast of churros or porras served with hot chocolate or coffee. Then, head to a local tapas bar where people from the neighborhood regularly gather. Visit a nearby market thats more popular with locals than tourists.

Throughout the tour, stop at a few bars and taverns that showcase the traditional flavors of Madrid and Spain. Its a relaxed and casual way to enjoy good food and learn more about local culture.

data.name: Royal Palace of Madrid: Fast Track Entry
data.shortDescription: Wander Europe's biggest royal residence at the Madrid Palace
data.description:
You wouldn't want to lose your keys in the Royal Palace of Madrid; with over 3,000 opulent rooms, it's Europe's biggest palace, and easily one of the most lavish too. With your ticket to the Madrid Palace, you can explore this palatial residence with fast-track access to jaw-dropping views of stately galleries and intricate rooms that housed some of Europe's most enigmatic royals.

Your Madrid Palace fast-track tickets offer a glimpse of the Crown Room, where you can walk down the halls with a regal demeanor. Inspect the weapons armory and contemplate the masterpieces in the painting galleries.

data.name: National Museum Thyssen-Bornemisza: Guided Tour
data.shortDescription: 800 years of art at one of the most spectacular museums in Madrid
data.description:
Get to know the history of Western painting with a guided tour of one of the best museums in the world.

With nearly a thousand works spanning the 13th to the 20th centuries, the Museo Nacional Thyssen-Bornemisza is the perfect place to learn about the history of painting in Europe. Take a tour with your art historian guide and be wowed by the works of artists across eight centuries, from El Greco to Dal, Czanne, Klee, Kandinsky, Rubens, Rembrandt, Renoir, Gauguin and more.  

Discover the signs and symbols hidden in the paintings, and feel inspired by the venue itself  the 18th-century palace of the Dukes of Villahermosa.

data.name: City Tour Madrid: 1 or 2-Day Hop-on Hop-off Bus
data.shortDescription: See the Spanish capital from the top of a bus
data.description: When you want to hit all the key Madrid highlights, then this Madrid Hop-on Hop-off Bus will get you there (and back). With 37 different stops and buses running every 20 minutes, it's the perfect way to discover the city at your own pace.

data.name: Museum of Illusions Madrid: Entry Ticket
data.shortDescription: A world of optical illusions and exhibits designed to trick your eyes and mind!
data.description:
Want to see your friend's head on a dinner plate? How about feeling tiny on a huge chair, or shrinking your sibling or friend? You'll question what's real and what isn't as your mind plays tricks on you at the Museum of Illusions Madrid. 

Come and learn about vision, perception, and the power of the human brain in a mysterious world of illusions. Nothing is what it seems! 

Don't forget your camera   there are loads of awesome opportunities for fun photos here!

data.name: Monasterio de las Descalzas Reales & Madrid de los Austrias: Guided Tour
data.shortDescription: Visit chapels with 17th-century art and walk through historic buildings
data.description:
Visit the Monasterio de las Descalzas Reales in Madrid, founded by Juana de Austria, daughter of Carlos I. The Monastery was built on the site of an old palace that belonged to the imperial treasurer Alonso Gutirrez. Carlos I and Isabel of Portugal lived there, and Juana de Austria was born there. Take a guided tour through various chapels and halls with 17th-century works and tapestries.

Next, a guide will take you through the city center, providing historical information from the era of the Austrias. Walk through hidden spots, historic buildings, and monuments. Hear anecdotes and legends from your guide.

data.name: Madrid: Flamenco Show at Tablao Torres Bermejas
data.shortDescription: Enjoy a show at a true cathedral of flamenco
data.description:
As you step into the Torres Bermejas flamenco tablao, youll feel transported from Madrid to Andalusia. Flamenco was born in the south of Spain, so its fitting that the tablao has been transformed to look like the Alhambra in Granada. 

With the stage set, get ready for a night that combines passion with talent. Dancers will storm the stage, practiced fingers will strike guitar strings, and the heat in the kitchen will be just as high as on stage as they prepare a traditional menu for you to enjoy. 

Add the option for dinner or a drink, for a complete flamenco experience.

data.name: Royal Palace of Madrid: Skip The Line Ticket + Small Group Guided Tour
data.shortDescription: Tour the palace halls and see state ceremony rooms
data.description:
Join the small-group guided tour of the Royal Palace of Madrid with skip-the-line entry. Visit the Royal Palace without waiting in long lines. See the architecture, art, and history up close.

The Royal Palace, known as Palacio Real, is the official residence of the Spanish monarchy, now used for state ceremonies. Learn about Spain's history and step into a world of kings and queens.

The tour guides small groups for a more detailed experience. Roam through the halls filled with centuries of European culture and see how this palace represents Spains past.

data.name: Madrid: Tapas Walking Tour + Flamenco Show
data.shortDescription: Prepare for a taste of Madrid's culinary heritage
data.description:
Explore the stories of Madrid through its bustling markets on a culinary trip guided by a gourmet expert. Discover signature cuisine in the renovated San Miguel and La Cebada markets in the La Latina neighborhood.

The food adventure starts at San Miguel Square, heading to La Latina, Cava Baja, and Cuchilleros streets, renowned for 'Tapeo.' Taste the distinctive flavors of traditional mushroom tapas or Padrn peppers, paired with a beer or cider.

Next, visit San Miguel Market for the famous Spanish omelet pincho and a chilled beer. Stroll through Plaza Mayor and Barrio de las Letras, significant to poets and artists. The adventure continues on Huertas Street, offering another culinary stop.

data.name: Madrid: 1.5-Hr Guided Electric Tuk Tuk Tour
data.shortDescription: Ditch cars and hop on a tuk-tuk to experience the beauty of Madrid
data.description:
Prepare for an adventurous tuk-tuk tour of Madrid.

Explore the old town, experience the modern Castellana, and visit the business hub of Azca.

data.name: Teatro Lope de Vega - El Rey Len
Royal Palace Skip-the-Line + Prado Museum
data.description:
Tick two of Madrid's essential monuments off your bucket list with this double fix of cultural treasures.

Start by entering the busy Royal Palace of Madrid, without queuing up! Although it is no longer the official residence of the Spanish monarchy, it remains one of the most important royal reception areas.

During the guided tour, you will have the opportunity to see the grand staircase, the flats of King Charles III, the Queen's flats, the banquet hall, the royal chapel, the throne room, and the crown room. Reach Prado Museum from the Royal Palace on foot.

The Prado Museum's current collection is made up of more than 1,000 works from four different centuries. Your guide will show you some of the most important works by artists such as Velzquez, Goya, Sorolla, El Greco and Bosch.

data.name: Ribera del Duero: Wine Tour and Tasting from Madrid
data.description:
Join a small group and head out of the busy city of **Madrid** for a **day trip** to the Spanish wine country **Ribera del Duero**.

Depart from Madrid in a **luxury vehicle** and head out to the vineyard-covered hills of Ribera del Duero. Your **professional oenologist** has curated a special itinerary to include only the best wineries in the region.

Savour up to **six tastings of Ribera del Duero wine** paired with fresh produce and **traditional snacks** as you learn about the wine-making process and the region's 2,000-year-old wine history.

Next, travel to Segovia, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and uncover its historical treasures.

Choose to enhance your experience with a traditional Segovian lunch featuring the renowned roasted suckling pig, a culinary icon of the region. The tour concludes with a scenic drive back to Madrid, leaving you with unforgettable memories of Spains wine and cultural heritage.

data.name: Madrid: 2-Hour Private Tour by Electric Tuk Tuk
data.description:
Discover Madrid in a fun and eco-friendly way during this private 120-minute tuk-tuk tour.

Get set to discover some of the city's main monuments the fun way! It's the perfect introduction to Madrid and your guide will recommend some great places to visit during your stay.

Check out the exterior of some of Madrid's most emblematic landmarks, such as the Royal Palace and the Almudena Cathedral. Stroll through the charming neighborhoods of Las Letras and Retiro, and see the Casa de Cervantes and the Church of Los Jeronimos.

See the Palacio de las Cortes, Puerta de Alcal and the museum facades of the Paseo del Prado on this exciting city adventure.

data.name: Monasterio las Descalzas: Guided Tour
data.description:
Meet your guide in the Plaza de las Descalzas, right in front of the entrance gate to the Monasterio Las Descalzas.

Enjoy a detailed explanation of its fabulous facade and exterior, and gaze around you at the beautiful interiors, Step into the cloister, home to the annual Procession of the Holy Burial, which takes place every year on Good Friday.

Don't miss the main staircase, considered by many to be the monument's real jewel. Its wall paintings were added at different times and on the ceiling, an impressive painting is attributed to Claudio Coello.

Visit the Tapestry Room and the Choir Room and see many interesting features, from plateresque doors to countless works of priceless art and paintings by some of the greatest painters in history, such as Zurbarn, Antonio Moro and Luca Giorda.

data.name: Tour of the best Ribera del Duero's wineries
data.description: Embark from Madrid on a journey that marries the rich flavors of Ribera del Duero wines with the historical grandeur of Segovia.In the heart of Spains esteemed wine region, visit a distinguished winery, where the art of winemaking comes to life. Stroll through verdant vineyards and delve into wine cellars, learning about the winemaking process from grape to glass. Enjoy an exclusive tasting, sampling three select wines, each paired with local culinary delights. This gastronomic adventure highlights Ribera del Dueros reputation as a producer of world-class wines.Next, travel to Segovia, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and uncover its historical treasures. Marvel at the ancient Roman aqueduct, a testament to architectural genius. Explore the Gothic Segovia Cathedral and the fairy-tale-like Alczar, immersing yourself in centuries of history.Choose to enhance your experience with a traditional Segovian lunch (UpgradeOption) featuring the renowned roasted suckling pig, a culinary icon of the region. The tour concludes with a scenic drive back to Madrid.

data.name: Toledo half-day tour from Madrid
data.description: Make the most of your stay in Madrid to discover Toledo, a UNESCO World Heritage city, with a local guide. On this half-day tour, you'll walk through the picturesque streets of The City of the Three Cultures and, enter the Church of Santo Tom and the Synagogue of Santa Mara la Blanca.Get on board a luxury coach in Madrid and enjoy a relaxing trip to Toledo. Upon arrival, you'll begin a panoramic walk from Toledo to the old town, where you'll visit the Town Hall Square and the interior of the impressive Cathedral (if optional cathedral visit is selected on the spot) otherwise youll have free time. Next you'll visit the old Palace of Justice and town hall and then continue to walk through the old Jewish quarter with narrow streets around the church of St. Tom featuring the famous painting by El Greco, the burial of count Orgaz. Your itinerary will continue visiting the Synagogue of Santa Mara la Blanca, which remains as a symbol of the Three Cultures union.

data.name: Private Segway Tour of Madrid
data.description: Get ready to discover Madrid from a different perspective!Your guide will guide you through parks and squares, and past examples of the best architecture in Madrid. In this 90-minute tour, you can choose between visiting the Historic Center and the Mirador de la Huerta de la Partida from where you can see The Cathedral from afar or walk in the Retiro Park visiting the Lake, the Monument to Alfonso XII, the Crystal Palace, the Fishermans House, etc On this experience, you'll be able to visit Madrid Rio. Park consisting of a pedestrian and recreational rea on the two banks of the Manzanares river, largely on the underground route of the M-30 ring road.At the beginning of the tour, you'll be able to decide the itinerary with the guide. An experience you can't miss!

data.name: Madrid mosaic e-bike tour
data.description: If you are planning to visit Madrid and discover all the emblematic areas of the city in just one day this tour is for you.Don't miss the opportunity to enjoy a full-day e-bike ride where you'll visit Madrids most diverse neighborhoods, largest parks, major landmarks, and hidden corners. Madrid Mosaic is the perfect tour if you want to go beyond the highlights and want to grasp the diversity of this city: from romantic neighborhoods and green parks to grandiose avenues, monuments, and a riverside bike lane.Youll see the best of Madrid in just one day. The route is approximately 31 kilometers (19 miles) long and takes about 6 hours. With several stops, including two refreshment breaks with snacks and tapas, theres time to rest, enjoy and experience the Spanish capital city.

data.name: Escape Tour self-guided, interactive city challenge in Madrid
data.description: At the beginning of the 19th century, Madrid was in the grip of the infamous bandit Luis Candelas. He was gallant, highly educated and a master of disguise. Being a very charming figure, he easily got close to the rich and managed to rob them before they knew what was happening. He got arrested many times, but he always managed to escape. Until he stole from a confidant of King Joseph Bonaparte, who ordered 300 of his best men to find Luis so that he can punish him. Help Luis find the secret passage out of the city, completing assignments, cracking codes, and deciphering cryptic clues. During this 2-hour city game you will have the chance to discover Madrid's history, streets and top sites in a fun and engaging way.

data.name: Private half-day highlights tour of Madrid with Prado Tickets
data.description: Madrid, Spain's stunning capital, is a vibrant city famous for its elegant boulevards and vast, dazzling Plazas like the portico-lined Plaza Mayor, in the heart of old Hapsburg Madrid. Youll see vibrant food markets, awe-inspiring cathedrals, and statues of famous Spaniards. The city is also very green with expansive, manicured parks such as the Parque el Retiro, where you will enjoy a stroll along as you bask in the sunny Spanish climate under fabulous blue skies! Spain has one of the oldest and proudest royal families in Europe, and it remains a working monarchy to this day.Learn all about the history of the Spanish royals, like Ferdinand and Isabella, Philip II and many others, whilst standing in front of the magnificent Royal Palace. The city is also famous for being a cultural hub and is home to several museums the most famous of which is of course the Prado, and your half-day highlights tour includes a fully guided tour of this repository of the best of Spanish art. Admire works by Goya and Velazquez, Bosch and El Greco among others and let your guide know if you have any favorites or must-sees. You will end your tour inside the Prado to continue exploring at your leisure, explore the gift shop and enjoy a well-earned coffee break at the caf.

data.name: Royal Collections Gallery and Royal Palace Guided Tour in English
data.description: Enjoy a tour of Madrid's royal sites to discover more than five centuries of history by admiring tapestries, decorative arts, paintings, watches and floats.The Royal Collections Gallery - the most important museum project in Spain - is located beside the Royal Palace. Together with an expert of art history, you'll explore the 3-floor building: the first floor is dedicated to the Austrians, the second one to the Bourbons while the third is dedicated to temporary exhibitions. An impressive display of 650 carefully selected pieces will take you back to another era full of luxury and refinement.After this journey through time, the guide will accompany you to the Royal Palace to appreciate its magnificence and visit its richly decorated rooms, to admire Stradivarius instruments, the Royal Chapel or the Throne Room.

data.name: Entrance tickets to OXO Video Game Museum Madrid
data.description: Embark on an immersive journey at the OXO Museum in Madrid, where you can delve into the history of the video game industry. This interactive experience allows you to not only observe but also engage with over 90% of the exhibits. From vintage classics to cutting-edge innovations, you'll have the opportunity to play and test a vast range of games.The tour, which spans across the past, present, and future of this dynamic industry, is designed to captivate your interest for approximately two hours. So, prepare yourself for an engaging exploration that transcends time, offering a comprehensive insight into the evolution of video gaming.

data.name: Tablao Torres Bermejas - Flamenco Show and Tapas
data.description: Make the most of your stay in Madrid and immerse yourself in the Spanish tradition with a complete experience. Music, culture, and gastronomy in the marvelous Tablao Torres Bermejas, located in the heart of the Spanish capital, a few steps from the impressive Gran Va.During this experience, you'll have the opportunity to relish an unforgettable soire, witnessing a unique artistic event performed by the best flamenco bailaoras, cantaores, and guitarists in the country. Get ready to admire the marvelous architecture of the Tablao that will transport you to the Alhambra de Granada as soon as you'll get in! Don't miss the opportunity to sit back, relax, and taste the flavors of a splendid wine selection while enjoying a unique performance.

data.name: Best of Madrid private introductory walking tour
data.description: Embark on a 3-hour tour of the most emblematic and beautiful places in Madrid, see the most popular highlights of Spains stunning capital city, and discover what makes the city so special.Madrid is a city of vast plazas, elegant boulevards, magnificent palaces, awe-inspiring Gothic churches, world-renowned art museums and vibrant, delicious food markets. It is also famous for its many green spaces and manicured parks.Go through some of the most iconic places in Madrid, including the Plaza de Oriente, Teatro Real, Palacio Real, Catedral de la Almudena, Mercado de San Miguel, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, El Oso y el Madroo, Puerta de Alcal, and the Parque del Retiro, one of Madrid's most beautiful parks. Along the way, you'll learn about the significance and history of each landmark, and gain insight into what makes Madrid such a special and unique city, and by the end of the tour, you'll have gained a deeper appreciation for Madrid's rich history and culture and a greater understanding of why the city has become such a popular destination.

data.name: Escorial and Valley of the Fallen half-day tour with entrance tickets
data.description: Make the most of your stay in Madrid to discover the treasures located in the city's surroundings. On this half-day tour, you'll visit the Escorial Monastery and the Valley of the Fallen with an expert guide.Join this experience in the center of Madrid, where you'll start a comfortable coach ride to San Lorenzo de El Escorial, located 45-km away from the Spanish capital. Once arrived, prepare yourself to enter the Monastery with your guide and learn the history of this UNESCO World Heritage Site. Marvel at the unique gardens of the palace and the must-see areas such as the Basilica, the Library, the Pantheon of Kings, the Pinacoteca, and the Museum of Architecture.Continue your experience by visiting the impressive Valley of the Fallen with your guide. Don't miss the chance to learn more about the history of this basilica which was built during the Spanish Civil War.

data.name: Madrid tapas and wine tour with rooftop drinks
data.description: Embark on a culinary journey into the true art of Spanish 'Tapeo'. This gastronomic adventure takes you from bar to bar across diverse neighbourhoods in Madrid, offering an authentic taste of Spain.The tour commences at San Miguel Square, leading you through the renowned hotspots of La Latina, Cava Baja and Cuchilleros streets. Here, savour the flavours of traditional mushroom tapas or Padrn peppers. Close to the initial stop, you'll discover a charming boutique, brimming with the essence of Spain. Indulge in a carefully curated selection of ham and Iberian sausages, expertly paired with quality wines.The journey continues through Plaza Mayor and Barrio de las Letras, areas steeped in history where famous poets and artists once thrived. Venture into Huertas Street, stopping at a historic yet refurbished eatery to sample meat cheeks or 'Carrilleras', served with smashed potatoes and a robust red wine. As you meander through Plaza de Santa Ana and the Spanish Theatre, soak up the lively atmosphere of the bustling terraces.Your final tasting stop presents a traditional plate of garlic shrimp, typically served in terracotta or clay dishes. To conclude this culinary expedition, ascend to a terrace boasting panoramic views of Madrid, where you can unwind with a glass of cava. The experience keeps going after the tour, sipping a drink and swapping stories with fellow travellers on the rooftop.

data.name: The Four Seasons by Vivaldi in Madrid
data.description: Witness the evocative power of Antonio Vivaldi's "The Four Seasons" performed by strings quintet and harpsichord in the extraordinary location of Ctedra Mayor of Ateneo de Madrid. Experience the most famous of Vivaldi's works and a revolutionary example of Italian Baroque music.Elvin Dhimitri, violin soloist and conductor of Opera and Lirica, has been recognized as an artist who can combine impassioned energy and vibrant communication. He was appointed Concertmaster of the Bilkent Youth International Symphony Orchestra in 1992. He performed for Luglio Musicale Symphony Orchestra of Trapani, La Nuova Scarlatti Symphony Orchestra of Naples, Toscanini Symphony Orchestra of Parma, to mention a few. He was appointed First Violin in the Rome Philharmonic Orchestra and he has been a member of the Rome and Lazio Symphony Orchestra since 1997.First TimeConcerto F XI No.4 in A Major - Allegro molto/Andante molto/AllegroConcerto La Rustica RV 151 in G Major - Presto/Adagio/AllegroConcerto RV 127 in D Minor - Allegro/Adagio/AllegroSecond TimeConcerto No.1 in E Major, RV 269, SPRING - Allegro/Largo/Allegro (Pastorale dance)Concerto No.2 in G Minor, RV 315, SUMMER - Allegro non molto - Allegro/Adagio-Presto-Adagio/Presto (Summer Storm)Concerto No.3 in F Major, RV 293, AUTUMN - Allegro (Peasant Dance and Song)/Adagio molto (Sleeping Drunkards)/Allegro (The Hunt)Concerto No.4 in F Minor, RV 297, WINTER - Allegro

data.name: Spanish cuisine guided tour in Madrid
data.description: Get a crash course in Spanish food and culture as you taste your way through the market stalls, pastry shops, and local eateries of central Madrid's most charming neighbourhoods.First up on your Madrid morning food tour, youll unlearn everything you thought you knew about churrosand discover the real origins of chocolateat a beloved neighbourhood caf serving up the best version of both in all of Madrid.Next, youll set off on the next stop in many madrileos morning routines: buying bread for the day. From there, its off to the market! Youll explore the vibrant Mercado de Antn Martn as locals from all walks of life do their daily grocery shopping. Along the way, youll stop at a variety of stalls to taste their finest products: olives, cured meats, locally sourced produce, and Spains very own liquid gold: extra virgin olive oil. You'll also sip Spain's favourite aperitif red vermouth and learn why it's special and when to drink it.Finally, youll finish your Madrid morning food tour on a sweet note at a pastry shop thats been going strong since 1855. Opened by the Spanish queens own personal pastry chef, this incredible spot is seemingly hidden in plain sight. You might recognize this elegant shop from Spanish-American chef Jose Andrs' travel show, which will make your tour even more special!

data.name: Segovia hot-air balloon flight with transfer from Madrid
data.description: Enjoy a lifetime adventure in one of the most stunning scenarios for a hot air balloon flight!The local operator will pick up you at your hotel accommodation in Madrid. You will relax in your luxury vehicle with WiFi on board until you arrive to the selected take off area in Segovia surrounds where your pilot will be waiting for you. You will enjoy a hot air balloon ride over the Medieval city of Segovia and admire the sunrise with the breathtaking views of the castle, the aqueduct, and the cathedral.During the ride, you will listen to your pilot talking about the buildings and check by yourself why Segovia was designated World Heritage City for its unique beauty. After a smooth landing it's time for a typical Spanish breakfast. Your flight deserves a celebration with a glass of Cava and a flight certificate signed by your pilot. Finally, your driver will take you back to Madrid.

data.name: Puy du Fou Espaa and Sueo de Toledo with transfer from Madrid
data.description: Discover the magic of Puy du Fou Espaa an unforgettable journey through Spanish history. Depart from central Madrid in a comfortable, air-conditioned coach and get ready for a day filled with excitement, culture, and breathtaking performances at one of Spains most unique theme parks, located in Toledo.At Puy du Fou, history comes alive through world-class shows packed with thrilling special effects, captivating storytelling, and impressive staging. You'll witness the heroic deeds of legendary figures like El Cid Campeador, Lope de Vega, and Christopher Columbus. Marvel at aerial exhibitions with over 200 birds of prey, dazzling equestrian performances, and immersive reenactments that will transport you through centuries of Spanish heritage.Stroll through meticulously recreated period villages, explore hidden corners full of charm, and treat your taste buds to traditional Spanish cuisine at the parks many taverns and eateries.As the grand finale, enjoy priority seating for the iconic "El Sueo de Toledo" night showa spectacular open-air performance featuring over 200 actors and riders, dazzling effects, and a sweeping narrative that covers 1,500 years of Spanish history. It's a once-in-a-lifetime experience you wont forget.After a full day of wonder and adventure, your return journey to Madrid will be the perfect moment to reflect on this magical trip through time.

data.name: Toledo guided Tour with Cathedral and main monuments from Madrid
data.description: Travel to Toledo from Madrid with an official guide to discover the secrets and mysteries of the "city of three cultures". This 8-hour tour explores Toledo's most valuable monuments and the historic center, declared a World Heritage site by UNESCO. Learn about the peaceful coexistence of the three major religions, while strolling through the narrow streets.Roam the streets as your guide tells you all about the emblematic places of the city, its history, its corners and anecdotes, and its main monuments such as the Cathedral. Enter a monastery of cloistered nuns, where you will taste typical Toledan marzipan, the jewel of the city's pastries. The nuns will show you a recipe that has been passed down from generation to generation for centuries!After the guided tour, you'll have some time to explore the rest of the city on your own.

data.name: 2-hour Private Segway Tour of Madrid and Retiro Park
data.description: Get ready to enjoy the Spanish capital from a different perspective! an easy and fun way to get to know the most emblematic places in Madrid is a self-balancing scooter tour. Visit Old Madrid, New Madrid, Retiro Park, and much more. In 2 hours you'll enjoy a complete self-balancing scooter tour of the most wonderful Madrid, starting in the Barrio de las Letras neighborhood, you'll cross such significant points as Plaza Mayor, the Almudena Cathedral, the Royal Palace, the Opera Square and Puerta del Sol or the New City like Museo del Prado, Santa Ana Square, Puerta de Alcala, Jernimos Church, and the Retiro Park. If you prefer you'll be able to choose the specific area to discover during the 2-hour tour. At the beginning of the tour, you'll be able to decide the tour with the guide that will accompany you during the experience.

data.name: Royal Monastery of El Escorial and the Valley of the Fallen trip from Madrid
data.description: Enjoy your visit through the Royal Monastery of El Escorial, an architectural ensemble declared World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Built in the 16th century, it is a symbol of the power of the government at the time. Accompanied by your guide, you'll discover the most important areas of the monument. You'll marvel at the building symmetry and renaissance style, as you walk along the site visiting the Habsburgs Palace, the Chapter House, the Basilica and the remarkable library.If you have chosen the option with a visit to the Valley of the Fallen, you'll get back on the bus for the short journey to the next destination. The Valley of the Fallen is located 9 km away from El Escorial, in Sierra de Guadarrama. You'll be able to see it from far away thanks to the monumental cross built above the site. The monument is an underground church built into the mountain and is topped by the worlds largest cross, which can be seen from miles away.

data.name: Art & Brunch at Museo Nacional Thyssen-Bornemisza tickets
data.description: Experience the Museo Thyssen with all five senses: the new Art & Brunch experience is a combination that allows you to enjoy a delicious brunch on Sunday from 11 am to 1 pm.Art and gastronomy come together allowing you to round off your visit to the museum with a full array of flavours, which begin with a pastry basket and a selection of bread as well as a delicious yogurt with dried and lyophilized fruits, fresh fruit and cold cuts, including delicacies such as Iberian pork shoulder and Mortadella Bologna. Fresh tomato, artisan marmalade, butter, olive oil and honey Fresh orange juice, coffee or teaChoose from a main dish of eggs Benedict with sauted tender leaf spinach and mushrooms, smoked salmon and Barnaise sauce; toasted focaccia with lacn, San Simn cheese, truffle cream and rocket; or a burger bun filled with beef, pickles, Cheddar cheese and barbecue sauce. Other options, at an extra cost of two euros, include Sloppy Joe eggs (scrambled eggs on a waffle with beef ragu and Parmesan cheese) or a delicious Karaage open sandwich (diced chicken and guacamole on a slice of puff pastry bread). The Thyssen will be a new temple of gastronomy for foodie art lovers, where you can enjoy a gourmet set menu while also attending one of the greatest events to celebrate the Year of Picasso and the 50th anniversary of the artist's death: the Picasso/Chanel exhibition.

data.name: Electric tuk-tuk tour of Madrid's historic center
data.description: This 60-minute ride will bring you the opportunity to discover the most emblematic areas, famous buildings, monuments, and points of interest. In addition, the multilingual drivers during the ride will tell you the most remarkable anecdotes of each place of Madrid.Turn your stay in Madrid into an unforgettable experience getting on an electric tuk-tuk and enjoy the historic center of Madrid.The itinerary includes the following attractions: Market of San Miguel, Atocha, Parliament, Fountain of Neptune, Prado Museum, Los Jeronimos Church, El Retiro Palace, El Retiro Park, Puerta de Alcala, Cibeles Fountain, Bank of Spain, Santa Ana Square, Almudena Cathedral, ant Royal Palace.

data.name: Magnificent Madrid Self-guided Tour for Kids &Families in English
data.description:
Packed with challenges, quizzes and fantastic facts, this is a unique, self-guided tour especially designed to keep kids 8-15 excited and the whole family having fun as you discover the extraordinary Retiro Park and its surroundings.

Our Magnificent Madrid route starts at Plaza de las Cortes (opposite Spain's Parliament building - easily reached by metro, bus or taxi) and leads you on a discovery tour through this magnificent part of Madrid and into the delightful Retiro Park. Follow the interactive map to carefully selected locations, explore the iconic sights and hidden jewels of the park, and have fun as a family with challenges that bring each site and its story to life.

You simply download our app, sign up, and your route will be waiting for you with full instructions!

Do the tour at your own pace, take a break if you want, and even come back another day to complete it. The perfect way to keep kids interested and parents happy as you explore this unmissable part of Madrid!

data.name: Arrival Transfer from Madrid MAD Airport to Madrid by Luxury Car
data.description:
Why spend your precious time waiting in long shuttle or taxi lines. Avoid the language barrier and currency exchange. Travel in style fromMadrid Adolfo Suarez International Airport (MAD)to your Hotel in

MadridCity Center by private vehicle and reach your final destination relaxed and refreshed.

data.name: 5-Day Small-Group Southern Spain Sightseeing Tour
data.description: Discover the highlights of Southern Spain, including Andalucia, Costa del Sol, and the cities of Cordoba, Seville, Ronda, Torremolinos, Granada, and Toledo on this 5-day tour. Travel by comfortable air-conditioned coach, and have all your logistics taken care of, including overnight hotel stays, breakfasts, entrance fees, and city tours with local guides.

data.name: Madrid: Treasure Hunt Experience
data.description: Explore Madrid in a fun, unusual way with this treasure hunt-themed tour. Begin with your group in Puerta del Sol, where you'll get your fist clue and dash off through the streets of the city. Work together with your group to solve clues and puzzles, stopping along the way for drinks in two different bars. The first team to complete the challenges and find the treasure wins.

data.name: Madrid Art Galleries and Studio Tour
data.description: Take a deep dive into Madrids contemporary art scene with this small-group tour of the Salesas-Chueca neighborhood. With a local artist as a guide, youll visit several art galleries, where you will meet with owners and learn about how the galleries operate. Youll also enjoy a visit to your artist-guides own studio for a more personal view of Madrids artistic life.

data.name: Touristic highlights of Madrid on a Private full day tour with a local
data.description: Madrid is romantic, historic, and gorgeous. Experience the best of everything in this city. Our fun and entertaining guide will make this a memorable experience for you filled with sightseeing, visitng local popular hangout places and trying the local food & drinks. It is one of the best experiences to immerse yourself into the rich Spanish culture.

data.name: A Self-Guided Tour of El Retiro Parks Rise, Ruin and Redemption
data.description:
On this self-guided walking tour led by tour guide and writer Felicity Hughes, youll discover another side to Madrids famous El Retiro Park.

The much-loved El Retiro Park is at the heart of Madrids picturesque Retiro neighbourhood. Long before it became a public park, it was a royal retreat. On this walking tour, youll explore the UNESCO World Heritage Site and hear its fascinating 500-year-long history.

On this tour, youll discover how the spiritual retreat of San Jernimo el Real church was later transformed into an enormous pleasure palace, find out how Retiros oldest tree survived the ravages of Napoleons invasion and learn about the rebellious Nobel prize-winning Ramn y Cajal by a monument to the neuroscientist.

You'll have a chance to take a peek at the peacocks strutting around a hidden walled garden at the far reaches of the park and see the lake in front of Palacio de Cristal where Pizarro the elephant used to bath

data.name: Half-Day Guided Tour of Madrid
data.description:
Join our half-day guided tour and dive into Madrids rich history, delicious food, and vibrant culture. Starting at Puerta del Sol, our expert guide will lead you through charming streets filled with fascinating stories.

Savor traditional Spanish treats like churros with chocolate and napolitanas at two of Madrid's oldest bakeries. Explore iconic landmarks including the Royal Palace, Plaza Oriente, the Opera House, and Almudena Cathedral. Wander through the historic Barrio de los Austrias, enjoy a local liquor at Plaza Puerta Cerrada, and visit the worlds oldest restaurant before admiring the stunning architecture of Plaza Mayor.

Stroll through the romantic Barrio de las Letras, once home to legendary Spanish writers, and finish your journey with a delightful traditional meal at one of Madrids oldest taverns. This half-day tour is the perfect way to experience Madrids history, flavors, and unique charm in a short amount of time.

data.name: Pic-Nic Experience in Madrid with Games and Snacks
data.description:
Experience the vibrant parks of Madrid with our Picnic Experience! Whether you're seeking shade under lush trees or soaking up the sun, Madrid's parks offer the perfect setting for a delightful picnic. Indulge in local delicacies like savory ham, artisanal cheeses, and flavorful olives, paired with refreshing drinks.

Join us for a sunny day filled with fun and laughter as we play games like ball, rope, cards, and water guns. Our knowledgeable guide will lead you to the most picturesque spots in Madrid's parks, ensuring you have an unforgettable experience. Soak up the sun, savor delicious food, and create lasting memories with friends in the heart of the Spanish capital. Book your picnic adventure now!

data.name: Private Walking Tour of the Center of Madrid and Retiro
data.description:
On this private tour, you will discover the highlights of Madrid with me, I will take you through the coolest neighborhoods with the most curiosities. I will take you from the highlights of Retiro, passing through Paseo del Prado and a small part of the Literary neighborhood until you reach Sol and continue through the old Austrias neighborhood.

In approximately 2 hours you will visit all these places; enjoying the legends, history, curiosities, anecdotes and experiences. I'm sure you'll have a great time. From there, stroll to a local eatery and indulge in crispy fried coda time-honored favorite in Madridbefore sinking your teeth into a classic calamari sandwich, a beloved snack enjoyed by locals. Finally, make your way to the iconic San Gines chocolatera, where steaming cups of thick hot chocolate await, paired with perfectly crispy churros.

All along the way, soak up fascinating stories of Madrids culinary heritage, history, and vibrant city life. By the end of this guided tour, youll have savored some of the most authentic flavors the Spanish capital has to offeran ideal introduction to Madrid for passionate foodies and curious travelers alike.

data.description:
Hello, I'm Adriana, a madrilea and food lover. I also study history, so of course I value our museums, beautiful architecture. But for me, the best way of understanding a culture is through its food.

In Spain, it all starts in the produce market. So that's what well visit: the local market in my neighbourhood. Just 10 minutes walking from Plaza Mayor, in La Latina.

Here, we'll go through the stands -and the history- that shape our cuisine. Fishmonger, vegetables and fruits, butchers,

And I'll make sure you try the real icons of our gastronomy: 100% iberian ham, proper extra virgin olive oil, aged Spanish cheese, and seasonal produce.

Everything we taste along the way is included.

After we finish, you can choose to continue with a pairing lunch at 13:00 and 19:00 of 5 drinks, 6 tapas and dessert or with a cocktail pairing dinner at 21:00 of 3 drinks, seafood paella, tapas and dessert.

data.name: Flamenco Show at Tablao La Carmela in Madrid
data.description:
Enjoy the true art of flamenco at Tablao La Carmela. Located very close of Puerta del Sol, in the old coal cellars of the Taberna "La Carmela" was a former Convent of La Victoria, demolished in 1836 after the War of Independence. Every night the best dancers (known as bailaores) come to the Tablao La Carmela, who will make you enjoy this art in each of their shows.

If you choose the "Picoteo Menu, you can discover the flavours that reflects the past and present of the tablao while you enjoy the show.

data.name: Prado Museum Guided Tour with Skip the Line Access
data.description:
Discover the most important art gallery in Spain, the Museo Nacional del Prado, one of the most visited in the world and with collections that stand out for being the work of great European artists and masters, led by its best guides.

A complete visit that takes place in the imposing building that houses the most important collection of paintings in the country. Velzquez, El Greco, Goya, Titian, Rubens and Bosco deserve special relevance, of which we can admire his best works with the most detailed explanations.

The Prado Museum is the best summary of the recent history of Spain, Europe and the world of its time that we can interpret and learn about through some of the works that have most influenced universal art. The almost 8,045 paintings, 9,561 drawings, 971 sculptures and 155 maps make up a unique collection in European art galleries. A whole inventory of art with which to review the best of our culture.

data.description:

There you can enjoy more than 7 shows and try the traditional gastronomy and immerse yourself in the Spanish history.

Enjoy "El Sueo de Toledo", the biggest show in Spain which has been awarded numerous times for its staging and its numerous actors and special effects.

data.description:
A very special visit to the only European capital of Islamic origin. Origin that goes back to the Middle Ages and of which we can see some archaeological remains that give us a more exact idea of how those beginnings were. A journey back in time to the middle of the 9th century.

We will talk about how the population lived at that time, their beliefs, routines, trades and other aspects that we know thanks to archeology. And all this explained by professional archaeologists.

An excellent opportunity to know the origins of Madrid.

data.description:
A walk through creativity.

There are corners of Madrid that beat with a special energy. On this route, we are carried away by the creative pulse of three neighborhoods that have been able to reinvent themselves without losing their essence: Chueca, Las Salesas and

Malasaa. Here, the artisan and the contemporary coexist in balance, giving life to projects that bet on sustainability, originality and know-how.

Our tour will take us to discover a ceramic workshop, a vibrant space where many things happen and a shoe store where each pair of shoes is the result of a meticulous artisan process.

We will explore the history behind a brand of sustainable bags, visit a jewelry school-workshop and get lost among concept stores that reveal objects with soul and purposeful design.

We will culminate the experience with a wine and cheese tasting, celebrating the flavors that, like the

craftsmanship, connect us with the origin, tradition and pleasure of things well done.

data.name: Private Day trip of Don Quixote in La Mancha
data.description:
Embark on our Don Quixote Tour to explore la Mancha. Trace the legendary journey of Don Quixote as your driver-guide picks you up from your hotel for a great experience. Our first stop is Ucls, home to a historic monastery, once headquarters of the Knights of Saint JamesCervantes' order.

Balancing history with culinary delights, we make strategic stops. Visit a traditional cheese factory, witnessing the crafting of Manchego cheeses. Sample and choose your favorite. The second stop is an ancient Manchego inn or restaurant.

In the afternoon, explore Belmonte Castle and marvel at its preserved architecture. The journey concludes at the windmills of Mota del Cuervo. A guided tour unveils the truththese were not giants but tools powered by wind to grind grains.

Throughout, our tour seamlessly combines history, culture, and culinary experiences for an unforgettable exploration of the landscapes that inspired Cervantes' masterpiece.

Your tour concludes at a centrally located bar, giving you the freedom to continue exploring Madrids lively nightlife and tasting scene on your own or simply make your way home at your leisure.

data.name: Madrid Local's Wine and Tapas Lunch Tour with a side of History
data.description:
Meet your guide in Plaza Isabel II to begin your Madrid Historical Walking Tour and kick things off with your first wine tasting. Sip a glass of fine Spanish wine and tuck into delicious Madrid-style croquetas as your guide offers an introduction to Spains winemaking history and heritage.

Then, follow your guide to the historic quarter of La Latina, stopping to admire the medieval buildings and learn the fascinating history of the barrio. Along the way, visit two traditional taverns and sample a variety of Spanish wines, including Rioja, Ribera del Duero, and white Ras Baixas wines. To accompany the wine, tuck into a feast of scrumptious tapas, including local specialties pinchos or tostas, sliced crunchy bread heaped with fresh ingredients; savor a delicious plate of "huevos estrallados", a mix of fried potatoes, Iberian ham, and fried eggs, a local favorite; and a platter of traditional cold-cut meats and cheeses.

With your appetite sated, stroll back through the historic streets of Madrid and end your tour in Plaza Mayor.

data.name: Madrid Cooking Class: Traditional Paella with Wine Pairing
data.description:
Immerse yourself in Spanish culinary culture with our traditional paella cooking class in Madrid. This hands-on, half-day experience guides you through crafting authentic paella from scratch, complete with perfect wine pairings.

During the class, you'll prepare your own paella under expert guidance and then gather at a communal table to enjoy a hearty meal. Savor a delightful spread featuring Spanish cheeses and charcuterie, refreshing gazpacho, your homemade paella, and classic desserts like churros with rich chocolate. Enhance your dining experience by sampling five exquisite Spanish wines thoughtfully selected to complement each course.

Ideal for food enthusiasts and those looking to enjoy a memorable day in Madrid, this cooking class combines learning, socializing, and indulging in the finest Spanish flavors. Reserve your spot today and experience the true taste of Spain!

Highlights:

  • Hands-on paella preparation with expert instruction
  • Communal dining featuring a variety of Spanish dishes
  • Five carefully selected Spanish wine pairings
  • Delicious desserts including churros with chocolate
  • Half-day experience perfect for culinary enthusiasts

Book Your Cooking Class Now! Join us for an unforgettable culinary adventure and take home not just skills, but delicious memories of your time in Madrid.

data.name: 14-Day Tour Portugal and Andalusia from Madrid
data.description: Portugal has written its history in Lisbon, city of colors. Art, flamenco and old times' mark are alive in every Andalusia's city.

data.name: Madrid Tour Consuegra and Los Molinos del Quixote de la Mancha
data.description:
Discover Consuegra: Mills, History and Adventure from Madrid

If you are in Madrid and want to immerse yourself in a destination full of history and charm, this tour to Consuegra is the perfect getaway. You will travel comfortably in a luxury car to the land of the mythical windmills, the same ones that inspired Cervantes in the exploits of Don Quixote.

Our adventure begins in the Spanish Steps of Consuegra, where you will have free time to have breakfast and soak up the local atmosphere. Afterwards, we will head to Cerro Calderico, home of the iconic mills. We will know their secrets, their history and how they have stood the test of time.

The experience becomes even more special as you enter the Rucio Mill, where you will discover how these giants transformed grain into flour, just as it was centuries ago.

Our next stop is the imposing Castillo de la Muela, a medieval fortress with breathtaking views of the Manx plain.

data.name: Madrid Small-Group Vintage Bike Tour
data.description: Take a journey around the landmarks of Madrid while riding a vintage bike on this small-group tour. Discover iconic landmarks like the Royal Palace, Literary Quarter, and Alcal's Gate while pedaling through the city's vibrant streets. With insightful commentary from your guide, gain insight into Madrids rich history and culture.

data.name: Dinner with Views of Almudena Cathedral, Madrid
data.description:
Join a 3-course dining experience in Sebastian's apartment in an 18th-century building.

Why we love this experience:

In the historic center of Madrid

Incredible views of the Royal Palace and the Almudena Cathedral

Watch the sunset over Madrid

A rich and flavorsome meal

Sebastin is a professional chef who studied gastronomy in NYC and Paris

He looks forward to welcoming you into his home!

data.name: Tour "Barrio de las Letras" Spanish Golden Age
data.description:
Welcome to the magical journey through time offered by the Literary Quarter Tour in Madrid! This enchanted corner of the Spanish capital is not just a place, it is a portal that transports us directly to the golden age of literature and history.

Imagine walking the same streets that once witnessed the inspiring muses of great literary geniuses. Yes, we are about to immerse ourselves in the very heart of a neighborhood that not only breathes history, but exudes it from every cobblestone!

Close your eyes for a moment and feel how time twists and folds, taking us by the hand back to the days when Cervantes wandered these narrow streets, and Quevedo left his poetic mark on every corner. The Barrio de las Letras is more than just a set of old buildings; It is a canvas on which the stories of the great writers who once called it home are painted.

data.name: Royal Palace of Madrid Private Tour with Tickets
data.description: Take a private tour of Madrids grand Royal Palace and discover the citys heritage. This tour grants you skip-the-line privileges in order to avoid the notoriously long lines to get into the palace. Wander the corridors with your informative guide and learn about Spains rich history as you visit the palaces opulent rooms.

data.name: Madrid Retiro Park Small-Group Electric Bike Tour
data.description:
Begin your exploration by meeting your guide in central Madrid and picking up your easy-to-use electric bike. Pedal through the historic Literary Quarter (Barrio de las Letras), once home to famed writers like Cervantes and Lope de Vega. Glide along Calle de las Huertas, passing iconic sights such as the Prado Museum and San Jernimo el Real church, en route to Retiro Park.

Discover why Retiro is counted among Europes most beautiful parks as you cycle beneath its tree-lined avenues, admiring monuments like the Crystal Palace and the Fallen Angel statue. On the return ride, follow a route that highlights essential Madrid landmarks, including the Alcala Gate, Cibeles Palace, and the bustling Puerta del Sol square, before arriving back at the starting point.

data.name: Toledo Tour from Madrid with Cathedral, Synagogue, Santo Tome
data.description: Known to some as the city of three culturesbecause of its Muslim, Christian, and Jewish heritageToledo is a stunning medieval city that's an easy day trip from Madrid. Take a trip to this UNESCO World Heritage Site with this guided group tour, complete with round-trip Madrid transportation. After easy coach travel, enjoy sights like the old city walls, 12th-century synagogue, and Primate Cathedral (Catedral Primada)all included.

data.name: Private Photographic Session by Puntos de Madrid
data.description:
You and your companion(s) will get an immortalized memory that you decide: A session with friends, an event, a birthday.

You and your companion(s) will be given the complete digital album of all the photographs taken plus the best edited photographs.

Bring back a good memory of your stay in Madrid!

data.name: Segway Tour Madrid monumental
data.description: Discover and enjoy Madrid by Segway. A Segway tour through the monumental center of Madrid. A journey through the history and culture of this city.

data.name: Self Guided Private City Quest Tour in Madrid
data.description:
Begin an exciting City Quest a treasure hunt, orientation game, and self-guided tour all in one. Solve puzzles and discover the Madrids's secrets with your smartphone. Fun for all!

Our City Quests are packed with riddles to solve, codes to crack, and interesting facts about the city's sights and history. It's a great way to explore the city while having fun with your team. And at the end of the quest, you get a summary of your adventure.

data.name: Madrid: Royal Palace, Almudena Cathedral Guided Walking Tour
data.description: The Royal Palace of Madrid is one of the Spanish capitals most impressive landmarks, but it's much easier to appreciate when you have a guide showing you around. With this shared tour, save time by not waiting in line, and avoid the frustration of discovering that tickets are sold out for your preferred slot. Then, enjoy a two-in-one experience when you visit the neighboring Almudena Cathedral with your guide.

data.name: Madrid Electric Bike Highlights and Parks Small-Group Tour
data.description: Effortlessly cruise through Madrids prime attractions in just a half-day with this electric bike tour. Breathe in the fresh air at parks like Retiro and Casa de Campo and visit sites like the Plaza Mayor all via electric bicycle, the ideal way to efficiently cover the citys best sites on the go. Its easy to keep up with your guide since this tour is limited to 15 people or less.

data.name: Madrid: Top Pub Crawl Madrid & Party
data.description: Mingle with fellow travelers as you soak up Madrid's famous nightlife during this bar and club crawl. Enjoy free tequila shots and a complimentary sangria at four different bars, plus VIP entry to a club in trendy Gran Via. Other activities include games, a limbo contest, karaoke, and the chance to win extra prizes.

data.name: Tour Museo del Prado Small Group Admission Included
data.description:
WE INCLUDE ADMISSION TO THE PRADO MUSEUM AND CERTIFIED GUIDE

Welcome, art lovers, get ready to live an unforgettable experience at the Prado Museum.

A chronological journey in the origins of painting and culminates in the first steps of Spanish modernism.

Great teachers, face to face: Velzquez, Goya, El Greco, Van der Weyden, El Bosco... His works will come alive in front of your eyes as you discover the secrets behind each brushstroke!

Without Spoilers:

The Descent of Van der Weyden

The Garden of Delights of El Bosco

The Mona Lisa (Leonardo's School)

The Tintoretto Washhouse

The knight hand in hand on the chest of El Greco

Rubens Three Graces

The family of Charles IV of Goya

The black paintings of Goya

2h and 30 min tour

We start outside, discovering the surroundings of the Prado, and then spend 90-105 min inside the museum.

At the end, stay inside and keep enjoying yourself at your own pace with the guides recommendations.

data.name: Madrid Tapas Mysteries Walk with Private Option and Pub Crawl
data.description: Discover the tapas and secrets of Madrid on this walking tour. With a guide, explore the citys historical lanes as you hear their ghost stories, legends, and mysteries; and visit three bars to enjoy shared tapas and a drink in each. Lastly, finish your evening by joining a pub crawl tour, with selected drinks included. If you wish, upgrade to a private tapas-and-mysteries tour for a more personalized experience.

data.name: Escape game Madrid, chase the killer
data.description:
A totally different activity: we propose the idea of overcoming the mythical "Escape Room", but in the street. So in reality, you will not have to leave any room, but you will have to perform different team activities to solve the enigma that surrounds you.

All this through a secret route through Madrid and its unique corners. Looking to strengthen teamwork, give true value to everything around us and, above all, bring the true essence of the city to everyone while you have a good time.

data.name: Madrid Central and Retiro Park E-bike Tour
data.description: A guided electric bike tour that will take us through the majestic center of Madrid. We will visit the Plaza de Opera, the Plaza Mayor, the Almudena Cathedral and the Royal Palace, and then we will go to the great Retiro Park. An impressive green area in the center of Madrid full of history, anecdotes and curiosities. We will visit its statues, its ponds or the Crystal Palace while our guide tells us all the history that this park contains. A guided tour on our latest generation electric bikes. Almost effortless!

data.name: Madrid: Royal Palace, Prado Museum Private Tour
data.description: Check off two of Madrid's top attractions in the company of a guide who shares their love of Spanish culture and history. This private tour includes skip-the-line access to Royal Palace and the Prado Museum as well as a walking tour of the old town of Madrid including its highlights and hidden gems.

data.name: New! Madrid: Not Just Another Tapas & Wine Tour by Eating Europe
data.description:
Skip the tourist traps and dive headfirst into Madrids food scene like a true insider! Wander through the charming streets of the Old Town and Barrio de las Letras, where every stop serves up unforgettable bites and hidden stories.

Kick things off in an underground cellar packed with Rioja wines and perfect your jamn ibrico slicing skills.

Skip the line and head straight to La Campana for Madrids ultimate fried calamari sandwichcrispy, golden goodness hugged by a soft bun.

In Barrio de las Letras, discover Spanish rice like youve never had before. Think paella, but fancier, bolder, and downright delicious.

Save room for dessert near Puerta del Sol, where you can treat yourself to creamy turrn gelato or a scoop of floral violet ice cream.

And dont miss Plaza Mayor and Mercado de San Miguel, landmarks that are as delicious as they are iconic.

Why waste time figuring it all out when Madrids tastiest spots are ready for you to explore?

data.name: Paella Workshop with Bottomless Sangria in Central Madrid
data.description: Discover a unique culinary experience with this paella and sangria workshop right in Central Madrid. All accompanied with the famous drink, sangra. Take home recipes to use at home.

data.name: Royal Palace of Madrid Skip the Line Guided Tour
data.description: Experience the grandeur and opulence of Madrids Royal Palace on our exclusive guided excursion. Our expert guides will take you on a fascinating journey through the history and architecture of this magnificent building, which served as the official residence of the Spanish monarchs until the early 20th century. With skip-the-line access, youll be able to bypass the crowds and step inside the palaces sumptuous halls and chambers, where youll marvel at the stunning artworks, tapestries, and furnishings that decorate every room. Discover the stories and secrets behind each piece, from the impressive throne room to the private quarters of the royal family. Dont miss the chance to see the breathtaking views of Madrid from the palaces stunning rooftop terrace. With our intimate and informative guided tour, youll gain a deeper appreciation for the role of the Royal Palace in Spanish history and culture.

data.name: Spanish Civil War start of 2 World War, Guernica Franco
data.description: Do you dare to live the most intense history of Spain: the Spanish Civil War, the testing ground of World War II and the beginning of the Dictatorship. Battlefronts and key sites, history, fun and learning, exclusive maps, images and videos, passionate local guide.

data.name: Madrid Tapas and Wine Small-Group Food Walking Tour
data.description: Taste and drink your way through central Madrid on this small-group food walking tour. Follow your guide to the areas hidden gems while sampling five tapas and five drinks in top eating and drinking locations around the city. Your menu includes Iberian ham products, Spanish cheeses, two Basque *pintxos*, mushrooms, chocolate churros, and more.

data.name: Midra 30, traditional Kessa and massage at Hammam Al ndalus
data.description: Experience the tradition of hammam while visiting Madrid with this entry pass toHamman Al ndalus, including a massage and body scrub. Take a break from sightseeing and relax in the hammam, which includes three thermal plunge pools and a steam room. Your pass includes a 15-minute massage and a 15-minute exfoliating body scrub.

data.name: Royal Palace Skip the line Private Guided Tour
data.description: Head to the Royal Palace with your guide, skip the lines and dive right into the history of this beautiful palace in this 2-hour private tour. Follow your guide through the Grand Staircase, the Throne Room and the Banqueting Hall, among others.

data.name: Private Transfer from Madrid city to Bilbao
data.description:
- Luxury, safe and reliable Private Transfer from Madrid city to Bilbao in Chauffered Luxury Car.

- Fixed price with no hidden costs after booking.

- Wide fleet of Mercedes Benz cars only.

- Certified professional uniformed drivers.

- Meet&Greet Service: We welcome you at the lobby of your hotel holding a board with your name.

data.name: Prado Museum & Reina Sofia Combo Private Tour
data.description: The Madsnail team has a unique aproach towards art and a great way to show it! Art Historians which are great docents at the same time, fun and profesional, one o a kind group of guides!

data.name: Skip the Line Royal Palace Madrid Exclusive Guided Tour
data.description: Skip the lines and see the exquisite Royal Palace at your own pace on this private, guided tour of the biggest royal residence in Europe. The official home of Spains kings, this palace in the city contains 3,000 preserved rooms, works of art, the royal chapel, and string instruments made by Antonio Stradivari. Follow your guide up the 70-step main staircase and discover whats inside.

data.name: Imperial Madrid Private Journey through the Austrias
data.description:
Embark on an intimate journey through the Madrid de los Austrias, enriched by the discovery of ancient Muslim walls, the indulgence in a local liquor tasting, and the savory experience of Madrid's famous tapas. This exclusive private tour, accommodating 1 to 12 guests, offers a fixed price for a group, not per person, making it an ideal choice for families, friends, or solo explorers seeking a personalized encounter with Madrid's imperial past and vibrant culinary scene.

Dive into the heart of Spanish history and culture, where every corner tells a story, and every taste leads to a discovery.

Reserve your private exploration today and savor Madrid in a way that's tailored just for you.

data.name: Northern Spain & Galicia 13 Day tour roundtrip from Madrid
data.description: An intense itinerary through the north of the Iberian Peninsula, starting in the Spanish capital and arriving to Portugal. Landscapes of traditions and sea. All the north green lands, laughs and fishermen.

data.name: Ephesus & Pamukkale (2 days by bus)
data.description: Night before bus for Kuadas. Early morning arrive to Kuadas and depart for Ephesus, one of the twelve cities of the Ionian League during the classical Greek period. Ephesus was also one of the Seven Churches of Anatolia (Asia) that are cited in the Book of Revelation. Next we will isit to the old Greco-Roman city of Ephesus, Marble Street, Odeon, Bouleterion, Temple of Hadrian and Serapis, Agora, Library of Celsus, Great Theater, Double Church, Arcadian Way and the Gate of Magnesia. Perhaps most importantly, we will make a stop at the last abode of Virgin Mary at Mount Solmissos. Enjoy a delicious lunch at Seluk and then see the sabey Mosque, one of the oldest and most impressive works of architectural art remaining from the Anatolian Beyliks. Lastly we will visit the Ephesus Archaeological Museum and the Temple of Artemis, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Dinner at hotel and overnight accommodation at 4-star hotel. The following day we will drive to Pamukkale (Cotton Castle), a beautiful and spectacular natural site near Denizli, unique in the world. Thermal spring waters have carved this fantastic formation of stalactites. Thermal waters have been used since Roman times for their therapeutic powers. Situated on the plateau are both the thermal center with its motels, thermal pools and ruins of the ancient city of Hierapolis. Monument on this side includes the ancient thermal baths which have been restored and converted into an archaeological museum. Return to Kuadas for return bus to Istanbul

data.name: Bosphorus Strait Afternoon Cruise with Cable Car to Pierre Loti Hill
data.description: See Istanbul from a completely different perspective with this half-day cruise along the Bosphorus Strait. Once the cruise begins, you're free to relax and take photos as you travel along this natural waterway that links together Europe and Asia. Enjoy the massive skyscrapers and colorful buildings bordered by the city's lush forests and tranquil blue waters. Try to spot some popular tourist landmarks like the Rumeli Fortress, a massive stone structure built on top of hills, and the opulent Dolmabahce Palace, which served as the main administrative center of the Ottoman Empire. Once the cruise is over, you'll then take a bus ride to get to the Teleferik Cable Car Station, where you'll get to see the magnificent Golden Horn, the primary inlet of the Bosphorus. Enjoy a scenic cable car trip up to Pierre Loti Coffee House, where French novelist Pierre Loti came for inspiration. Soak up this unbeatable view of the surrounding areas, with gorgeous views stretching down to the Galata Tower.

data.name: Cradle of Civilizations - 6 Days (By Plane)
data.description: Day 1: Sunday Early morning pick up from city hotels around 05:00 and transfer to airport for flight to Ankara. Around 08:00 arrive to Ankara Esenboga Airport and meet with our representative. Visit the Anatolian Civilizations (Hittite) Museum and Mausoleum Of Ataturk, founder of the Turkish Republic. After lunch, depart to Cappadocia via Salt Lake and Seldjoukian Caravanserai. Dinner and overnight at a 4* hotel in Cappadocia. Day 2, Monday Breakfast at hotel and departure after breakfast for a full day tour of Cappadocia. Citadel of Uhisar, open-air museum of Greme Valley with Fairy Chimneys, Underground City of Kaymakl, Paaba (Monks) Valley and Avanos. Dinner at hotel and overnigh at a 4* hotel in Cappadocia. Day 3, Tuesday Breakfast at hotel and early departure for Konya, city of the "Whirling Dervishes". On the way, visit the 13th century Seldjoukian Sultanhan Caravanserai. Visit to the Mausoleum of Mevlana, world famous philosopher and poet and his theological school of the whirling dervishes. Dinner at hotel and overnight at a 4* hotel in Pamukkale. Day 4, Wednesday Breakfast and visit the ancient city of Hierapolis. The ruins of the biggest Necropolis Graveyard of the ancient world, Roman Baths, Basilica and calcium cliffs. Drive to Meryemana and visit House of Virgin Mary. After lunch Continue to Ephesus, the Romen Capital of Asia Minor. Visit the ruins of Odeon, Hercules Gate, the Temple of Hadrian, the magnificient library, Agora and fantastic greco-roman theatre.Dinner and overnight ( B,L,D ) Day 5, Thursday Early departure for Pergamum. After lunch visits of Asklepion . Continue for Troy. The legendary town in the iliad of Homeros, visit the Athena temple. Drive to anakkale, dinner and overnight Day 6, Friday After breakfast cross the strait by ferry and drive to stanbul along the shores of Marmara sea.

data.name: Best of Old City Guided Tour with Lunch
data.description: Istanbul straddles East and West, enticing your senses and expanding your perceptions of the world around you. Todays full day tour will give you a glimpse at some of Istanbul's incredible sites and sounds and leave you with a deeper understanding of this rich land. Begin your day at one of Istanbul's greatest architectural masterpieces - the Hagia Sophia. This 6th century basilica will stun you with its towering minarets and beautiful handcrafted mosaics. It is called, by some, the 8th wonder of the world and you'll soon see why. Soon after your visit to Hagia Sophia, head across the street to the Blue Mosque. One of the most famous monuments in all of Turkey, the Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmet Mosque) is a monument to the Ottoman empire and its builders. It gets its name from the more than 20,000 Iznik blue tiles that adorn its facade and interior and its history will impress you as you receive a tour. Then step back in time a bit to the Hippodrome. Here, imagine what life might have been like as locals traveled to see the chariot races at this famous sports arena. The area dates back to Egyptian times and there are still relics of the past dotted around this incredible area. With so much history, it's time to take a little shopping break. Head to the Grand Bazaar, where you'll have the chance to barter on everything from fine leather goods, to spices and plenty of sweets to satisfy your sweet tooth. There are nearly 4000 stalls here, so you're sure to find something for yourself. After lunch visit the recently discovered and restored erefiye Cistern, which was built by Roman Emperor Theodosius II between 428 and 443 to store water supplied by the Valens Aqueduct (Roman Period Water Reservoir). Your tour ends here.

data.name: Cappadocia in 1 Day - By Plane
data.description: Early morning pick up from city hotels and transfer to airport in Istanbul for flight to Cappadocia. Meeting at Kayseri or Nevsehir Airport and transfer to Cappadocia to meet with the group and guide. Walk through the Fairy Chimneys in Devrent Valley, Paaba (Monks) Valley, practice pottery production with the ancient technique in Avanos. Visit to Greme, the "open-air museum holding the earliest churches and chapels carved in fairy chimneys presenting finest examples of frescoes. Uhisar Castle, the highest point in the region. Lunch will be during the tour. Evening transfer to Kayseri or Nevsehir Airport for flight back to Istanbul. Meeting at Istanbul Airport and transfer to hotels.

data.name: Priene, Miletos & Didyma by Bus
data.description: The night before, take a bus to Kuadas. Then we will drive to Priene, the first grid-system planned city of the ancient world, built on a lovely hillside. We will take a tour of the many impressive sights including the Priene Theater, the Temple of Athena, the Bouleuterion, the Agora and the Altar of Zeus & Cybele. From there we will proceed to the Ionian city of Miletos, the home of Thales. Next a visit to the Delphinium, the Nymphanion, the Theater and the Faustina Baths. We will enjoy a lunch at a local restaurant before continuing to Didyma to visit the Temple of Apollo with its gigantic columns which was the biggest Oracle Center of ancient Trkiye. Night bus from Kuadas to stanbul
